reviewText: I am not one to write reviews, but this strap is amazing.  I've paid hundreds of dollars on similar mesh straps, both OEM and aftermarket, and this one is right on par with them.  It's solidly built, with good finishing along the sides (no sharp edges at all).  I paired it with a Seiko Turtle, which I think pairs perfectly.  The only reason I give it 4 stars is that the clasp is not the easiest to operate.  Highly recommended.

reviewText: Excellent quality for the price.  The band does not pull hair, as another reviewer has suggested. It fit's a 22mm opening perfectly and comes with the spring pins as well as a pin removal tool. You really couldn't ask for more at this price.  Buy it, you won't be disappointed.

Fast shipping great product

I bought this for my Pebble Time watch. The band comes with a tool and 2 pins. I'm handy with watch parts - I've replaced bands and adjusted links for many years. The pins that came with this band just wouldn't fit into my watch. But I have lots of pins on hand, and using those made the connection in about a minute.

Adjusting the length (or tightness) was really easy using the inclosed tool. From the "outside" of the sliding connector, just pry the flap open, adjust and push the flap back down. Test and repeat as needed. It took me three adjustments to get it just right.

The band looks great on the watch and I get even more complements now than with my previous leather band.

1 star off for the pins. Otherwise it's perfect!

Update: The clasp doesn't always stay latched. Make sure you have a solid click when fastening, and check while you are wearing it.
summary: Great for my Pebble Time watch.

reviewText: very nice.
Great looking watch band!  Very to easy to put onto the watch and very easy to adjust the size.  I've only had it about a week so, don't know about durability yet.

The quality of this band is pretty good, I like the way it feels when I wear it. I bought it for my Pebble Time Steel and it fit that watch great. The quality is very good for the price. I would recommend the band.

One of the problems I was having is that it would catch on fabric where the ban attached to the watch, like it was snagging somehow. I'm not really sure how because inspection did not show any edges or catches anyplace so it may just be me. Besides that, I still like the band. Its light and feels better than most metal bands to wear since it adjusts to your wrist like fabric.

Also, there were not any instructions on how to adjust the band length, I did figure out that its a spring action under the clasp that you use to pop up and just slide to the position that you want and then pop down the spring metal. Don't be tempted to take it apart, just pry up the spring and slide to the right length.

One thing I noticed, there is a small notch on one side, where the pin fits in that is used to attach the watch to the band. That notch allows you to use the included tool to take the band off but the other side of my band did not have the same notch, so getting that side off and on is a little harder to do. The picture shows the notch on both sides. I'm not sure why but mine did not have it on one of the sides. (Also, this notch may be the cause of the catch I mentioned above, it's the only spot that has a slight edge to it.)
summary: Like the band, looks good and is of good quality.

reviewText: Looks great with the Urbane.  I really like the continuous and easy size adjustment.  I had purchased a metal band with removable links but couldn't get the thing small enough for my mid sized wrist and the giant watch.

1. This watch does not come with any instruction on how to adjust the brand. I have to do a ton of research to figure it out. I ended up bending one of the parts because I could not figure out how to unlock it.
2. The watch spring load pins are entirely too small. The watch band moves around when attached to the watch.

Unfortunately, I do not believe I will be able to return the band due to damage.

Don't buy.
summary: Do not buy - You've been warned

reviewText:
The Watchband is quite well made, solid build, BUT there are some issues with it.

1) The band pins it comes with are a bit too small for the watchband leading to a loose fit. I had extra pins that were thicker that resolved the issue.
2) The longer legnth of the band which holds the base of the clip, is slightly warped, likely with the way the band was created, it's minor, and not highly noticeable, but it is an issue.

Outside of that, it looks great, and really compliments my LG Urbane.
summary: Great build quality, but a couple issues...

He was so pleased with this band that he wasn't interested in the original. Got lots of compliments. The included tool was helpful in getting it onto the watch.

Only complaint is that it did have a habit of pulling on my arm hairs.

It is made solid and is rather heavy, if that is of any concern. Added considerable weight to the Moto smart watch.

This is a very good-looking band when paired with my Galaxy Gear Live. The chrome body of the watch blends right in with the steel of the band and makes it look like they were made to go with each other.
The band is really easy to adjust for size...no removing links or anything like that. Just pop up the tension bar, slide the latch to the place you need it to fit your wrist, clamp the tension bar back down. Now you just have to hook the clasp on the latch and you're out the door with a watch that fits the way it's supposed to.
The cut and polish of the band make it look good and the band is nice and heavy so I don't feel any fear of it breaking or wearing out.
summary: This is a good, heavy, easy to adjust watch band. The cut and polish look really good next to the chrome on my Gear Live.

reviewText:

Fits the watch pretty well, it may actually be a 21 mm because there is a bit of play in it but not enough to make me think it's not right. Adjusting it was easy to do. It's comfortable and wears easily. No pulled hairs or anything like that so far. The clasp hasn't given me any troubles, it has stayed closed and not loosened up at all.
Overall I am pretty happy with this. It looks nice. It's a little brighter than the watch itself but not too bad. Hopefully it will hold up well.

reviewText: I purchased this Watch band for my Pebble Time Steel.  Unfortunately Pebble had to delay shipment of the metal bands to their Kickstarter backers, but thankfully the Time Steel uses standard 20mm bands.  This band is so good, I don't even miss not having the Pebble metal band.  The clasp is easy to use.  Adjustments can be done with just a flat bladed screwdriver (no need for a jeweler's hammer and center-punch).  Best of all, it's super comfortable to wear all day long.  No pinching or pulling hairs.
summary: Not missing my delayed Pebble time watchband.

reviewText: This band looks good from 5 feet and has a nice heft to it, but upon closer inspection it has sharp edges and generally cheap and poor finishing, like it was simply cut from a wide swath of metal mesh. I found some visual instructions on another Amazon listing but was unable to adjust the band.

reviewText:
This band is a heavy, shiny, tightly-woven beauty. The adjustable clasp holds its position. It is remarkable that a band of this quality is available at this price. Do not hesitate to buy, this is a keeper.

(One note: I fitted this band to my Seiko SKX007 Divers Watch, which features famously fat spring bars. I had to pry the rolled end links to fit the bars using the tines of a stainless dinner fork. It took me about five minutes. This is only necessary with overbuilt fat spring bars. Standard 22mm spring bars will fit just fine. See attached picture for my results.)

It was easy to install on my LG G Watch, it looks really nice stainless has a great contrast to the black shell. The band adds a nice weight to the watch, which helps the watch charge, and it's comfortable. Since adding the band, the watch has been confused as an apple watch on a number of occasions, which isn't a bad thing. A $10 addition made my $50 watch look like a $300 watch.
summary: It was easy to install on my LG G Watch

reviewText: After seeing all the band options on a competitors watch, i got bored with the stock watch band on my LG-Gwatch. My first instinct.  "Well I'll check on Amazon". After about 5 minutes of browsing different options I decided I wanted a stainless steel look  This was the first option.  Of course I was skeptical of the price point ($10.99 and free 2-day PRIME shipping)  But after reading several reviews I figured I would take a shot.  Boy was I glad I did!  The most difficult part was installing.  However, I don't blame that on the manufacturer of the band itself, but rather on the watch design.  It's a standard watch pin system (it took me about 45 min to install completely due to my fat fingers). I've only had it 2 days and I've received many different compliments on it.  I highly recommend it if you're in the market  I've included some pictures of how it looks.
The quality seems ok for the Price
Cool band but there are a few crude build practices here. Worth the money.
Ordered a great watch from jump hour watch from Alpha Watch, but I have small wrists and the band didn't fit.  Bought this band to go with it and it looks and fits great.

I like this product. It fits my Pebble Time and a woman's wrist without having the extra length of the band flapping about. I do wish the clasp snapped shut more crisply. It's hard to get it to snap securely sometimes and I have to fuss with it. But so far, my watch hasn't fallen off.
Very cheap looking.  Too shiny and makes the Urbane look very cheap.  Also its not very flexible and isn't comfortable.  Also its definitely not like in the picture, the chains are half as small.

I think this band is amazing for the price. I love everything about it. Only one problem.  The clasp was bent when I got it. I've tried to mend it myself and I got it pretty good. But the hold is shaky at best. It was packaged pretty well so I'm not sure at what point it got bent. But it will do for now.

Works very well with my Asus Zenwatch.  Word of warning:  The clasp system complete separates the two sides; it is NOT the style where the clasp system essentially makes the watch band wider so you can take it on and off.  It's a little more complicated to put on, but it's really not that bad.  The tool that is included is garbage (breaks under the slightest amount of force), but thankfully it's not necessary for anything.  You can pry up the little clamp that keeps the adjustable part in place with a knife (be careful!) or a small screwdriver.  Once it's up, tug on it with some force and it will move.  Use both thumbs to push it all the way back down.

Unlike the included tool, the band and clasp feel top notch and extremely sturdy.  The two included pins worked fine on my watch.  If you want a metal band without annoying links that can break or have pins fall out, get this guy.  It's a steal at $11.
summary: but it's really not that bad. The tool that is included is garbage (breaks ...

The appearance of this is just what I was looking for in a wrap for this Shanghai Glamour party I'm going to however:
1) It's very short. I'm 5'7, 120lbs and don't consider myself to have broad shoulders but it barely wraps around.
2) There is a large round button-type brooch which looks like you would be able to button it but there are no holes on the other end of the wrap to insert/button it with. What is the point of the button/brooch? I guess it's purely decorative but it's misleading.

I don't know if I'm going to keep this. If I keep it then that means I have to risk ruining it by somehow cutting a hole on the other end of the wrap so the button/brooch can hold it together without me manually holding on to it - which was the look I wanted. If I don't then it's too late for me to get a different wrap for my costume. I'll update later with pictures regardless of whether I decide to keep it or not.
summary: Too short and button/brooch is purely decorative, not functional

nice

Just what I was looking for! I was able to apply to a textured door without any problems (see customer images).

I cut off the TOILET letters at the bottom and then sliced the man and women apart evenly. I wiped down my door with some mild commercial surface cleaner, wiped clean with water, and dried with a clean towel. I followed the instructions on applying the decals and they went on first try, no problems.

The instructions did note that the decal could be applied with the included "scrapper" (I can't remember the exact description they used) or a similar device such as a credit card. However there was no "scrapper" in the packaging, but I really wasn't expecting one.
summary: Easily cut to fit; just what I needed

reviewText:
For a 7 dollar dress, I am so pleased!  This dress fit exactly as others had described.  I usually order a Small ( I am 5'6" and 135 lbs) but I ordered a Medium in this dress based on other's recommendations and it fit so very well.  It is a nice weight, almost t-shirt like material, not clingy but also not too thick or thin.  The white piping is a rope like material sewn on, almost like a huge shoelace.  It is not constricting in any way, and moves well.  This dress has a great early 1960s feeling to it, so I paired it with my white pillbox hat and some nude pumps and wore it to my best friend's first mass.  Great dress for church or the office!

At this price, you can't beat it! Highly recommend.
summary: Cute 1960s vibe at a price you can't beat!

reviewText:
This dress was better then I expected. I usually wear a large, so I ordered a XXL and it fit perfectly. The buttons are real, not just coloured in the fabric. I wouldn't recommend it for a cocktail party like they say, but it would be fine for work.
The only thing I didn't like was the neckline. I was expecting a mid chest squared off neckline. The shape was right, but it sits extremely high. The top was maybe an inch below my throat. It looked okay, just not what I wanted.

I waffled between giving 3 and 4 starts. Mostly because if you purchase this you have to bear in mind that this is a $9 cotton dress - you get what you pay for! It is by no means business formal. This is much more appropriately labeled business casual. The dress is very thin material - certainly make sure you wear flesh tone undies! The hemline doesn't have that nice finished look, instead it has the look of clothing made from thin, cheaper material. Something akin to what you might find in Wet Seal - we all know the inexpensive looking business wear young people put on in the beginning of their careers. It's just a smidgen larger than I would like, but I purchased a large size anticipating that this might be the case. I'm typically a size 10/12 - depending on the produce and if I've been working out that week. I'm hoping because this is cotton I can wash it and shrink it down with a wash and dryer cycle. All and all, I'm pleased with the product for the price. I started a new job and just needed a few more business casual outfits for when I have to go to meetings or be in the office. This will be nice for the hot-humid summer when I have to take metro and walk a lot.
summary: Good for the Price - Not Business Formal

reviewText: Very nice dress. Feels super sexy going on. I love the couture on the dress and shape fit perfectly. Exllent material

Material is kind of thin but this is a great dress. It's clearly not expensive but it's still cute. Not sure how long it'll last after washing, but it's still cute for now. Can't beat the price. I received this at a discount in exchange for my feedback.  I ordered it a little bigger since others recommended buying a size up.

The fabric is thin, the design lines appear to be made me shoe lace fabric, and the hem on the breast is unevenly sewn, causing it to not lay or look totally flat. However, I wear this dress to work at my salon, and receive compliments on it ALL day.

The fabric is soft and very comfortable. I really do love wearing this dress. Although I would never wear a dress of this quality to a wedding, I would wear it to breakfast or at the office. The material actually makes it look more vintage, and I wouldn't die if I got something on it, like ink or hair dye.

Because the fabric is thin, don't wear underwear with heavy lines or a bright colored bra. To avoid, I'd suggest wearing stockings, or nude colors beneath. It's not totally sheer, but sheer enough to not wear shorts beneath or something highly patterned/embroided. Pretty standard for inexpensive women's clothes.

The color is true to the picture, and I am debating buying another just because! I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.
summary: Despite it's flaws, It was a hit!

reviewText: This is a review for the Fashion Celeb Women Formal Business Pencil Black Evening Party Dress in navy blue in size XXL.  This dress is made of a stretch material, so you do have some give to it.  The XXL fits like a US size 12- 14 dress.  I am 5'6" and I wish the dress was a little longer then it is on me.  It sits right around my knees. In the photos here It looks like it would sit mid calf, however that is not the case for me. I fear it might shrink up after washing a bit as it is cotton and become even shorter.  It is always a possibility with cotton clothes depending on how the are cut, they can shrink up to be shorter, or in to a smaller size..  The dress itself is comfortable and fits snug to your form.  It is not too snug.  I would recommend ordering up if you can, it does come from china and there sizes are way off for US standards.  I received this dress as a promotional test product at a discounted testing price to review.  This is my honest and unbiased opinion after receiving and wearing this dress.
summary: The XXL fits like a US size 12- 14 dress

reviewText:
For the record, I already knew that this was Chinese sizing and ordered a couple of sizes up - hence while I marked the fit as "too small", the size I ordered or my daughter actually fits nicely. My daughter wears a US small (6-8) and we ordered a large. It was a wee bit on the big side right out of the bag, but after tossing it into the washer and dryer (on warm) it drew up just enough to fit well. We might have been able to get by with a medium, but I suspect it would have been too tight to look good. The sizing chart states that a large is equivalent to a US 8-10, however, and I'd say that's probably not too far off.

This JNTWorlld Fashion Celeb Ladies Button Formal dress is made of a lightweight cotton knit, and is extremely soft. It's definitely a summer-weight fabric, so if you live in a cold climate you'll want to layer it with tights, a slip, etc., when the thermometer dips. My daughter says it feels like she's wearing a nightgown. Despite the comfort level and fabric weight, it looks professional. It strikes her just below the knee, making it appropriate for work, and surprisingly hangs well and does not cling. As I mentioned before, it's simple to toss it into the washer and dryer and it comes out wrinkle-free and soft. I would recommend hanging it up right away though - since the fabric is a cotton jersey knit if you let it sit in the dryer I can't vouch for the wrinkle-free factor.

We ordered the lighter blue version and there was no sign that the blue color faded onto the white trim when it was washed in warm water. The trim itself is a textured ribbon, and the buttons have kind of a shell-look finish. All in all, as long as you buy this larger than your normal size, it's a terrific wardrobe option to dress up or down. It looks better in person than in the photo, for the record. Very cute professional wear.

The dress is shipped through Amazon, which makes for quick delivery. If you're on the fence about buying this dress, get off the fence and order. You'll be glad you did.

I received this product at a reduced cost in exchange for a full and balanced evaluation and honest review. This is definitely one of the better buys I've made in terms of clothing.
summary: Order up one size and you'll love it.

reviewText:
This easily would have been a 5 star rating, if the silver color on the skulls hadn't started coming off within a few weeks of wearing them.  It makes them look dirty.  How is the seller allowed to say that the item is surgical steel and not disclose that this doesn't include the skulls?  It's misleading, and actually dangerous to those who are allergic to certain metals.

Otherwise, these are very well made.  They look good, and they fit together perfectly.  The skulls stay in place, but aren't too hard to remove for cleaning.  If they replaced the skulls with true stainless steel ones, I would gladly pay more for them.

reviewText: Well worth the money. Washed up nicely.

Bought this polo to add to my numerous JC Penny Foundry XLT Polos. They will be the metric by which these (I ordered a Navy and am waiting for it to arrive) are reviewed.

Overall the fabric is thin, which will make a great summer polo. Putting it on for a test fit I could easily see through the material even though it is a dark green. This may be a downside as it likely won't last as long as the Foundry Polo which is thick and solid.

As for length, I hope this shrinks in the wash a bit. For an XLT the sleeves come almost to my elbows and the shoulders go past mine. I have a broader build so I was surprised that this polo was so wide. Overall this polo fits more like a 2XLT in my opinion. Even the length is super long. This polo reaches almost to the crotch of my pants; there is no way it is pulling out.

A style note is that this is a solid polo, unlike the Foundry polos it doesn't open up at the sides on the bottom hem. This is a style choice but according to the powers that be, they require straight polos like this Joe's USA to be tucked in.

So, compared to the $15-25 Foundry Polos from JC Pennys (When they are on sale) I would say that I am not completely satisfied. I will probably keep this one and the Navy one as, for $10, they aren't worh the trouble to return and will make decent enough shirts for backup.
summary: Fits like a 2XLT, thin fabric, VERY long

reviewText:
You get what you pay for!! I bought this shirt for my husband, wanting to try a new brand of shirt, besides what we usually get at the big anchor stores at the mall. These ran a few dollars less than our usual buys (on sale).

It arrived in a plastic bag. No tags. No stickers.  My husband tried it on to see if it fit. It seemed a little thinner than his usual shirts but looked and fit fine. Then I washed it with a load of other similar colored polo shirts.

When I pulled it out of the dryer the shirt was ruined with these rectangular marks on them. My dryer works fine. There was nothing on the shirt or in the dryer or other clothes to cause perfectly shaped rectangles. This has never happened with any other shirts. It's only this one. Only this brand. What a total waste.

Buyer beware! Spend the extra few bucks and stick with the quality stuff.

reviewText: I bought one of these to test  before buying more. I'm 4XL-T, so fit isn't easy as on a 'regular' sized guy. I wore it out of the package and it fit great, and doesn't hang badly at the shoulder even though it's a big shirt. Collar seems to hold it's shape well without ironing (directions say do not iron, btw). The real test for me was after washing, since that's when these shirts shrink. I was pleasantly surprised that there was hardly any, if any, shrinking on this shirt. It fits as well after washing as it did new. I'm getting ready to order several more for summer. If  you're looking  for a solid shirt at a decent price, especially if you're a big fella, this is a good option!

reviewText: Just fine

Since my main complaint is about fit, I'll start this off by telling you that I'm 6'4", 225 lbs, with a 38 waist.  I'm not fat, but I'm definitely out of shape.

I got the LT size, and washed it before wearing.  The shoulders and chest fit perfectly.  However, when they say this is a "tall" shirt, they're not kidding.  It looks like I'm wearing a cocktail dress.  The bottom of the shirt comes down past the crotch of my jeans -- and I don't exactly wear my pants pulled up to my eyeballs like Steve Urkel (though I do wear glasses and I like cheese, so take from that what you will).  I'm guessing someone would have to be 6'8" or so for this shirt to look normal on them.

I don't think I have a terribly short torso either.  I mostly wear IZOD polos in an LT size, and they fit great.  (Though they are 2 - 3 times the price, and not available in as many colors as Joe's USA offers, here's the link if you're curious: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00I6CR778 ).

Obviously if you're about my height and you plan on tucking the shirt into your pants, then the extra length will be a good thing.

As other reviewers have pointed out, the material is thin.  A lot thinner than the IZODs I usually wear, but it also feels thinner to me than a Hanes Beefy T.  The fabric also looks more like a T-shirt.  In other words, it looks like a cheap polo.

Then again, thin fabric can be an advantage if you'll be spending a lot of time outside in a hot climate.  But I'm spending most of my time in an office so it doesn't help me at all.

I'm also not impressed by the stitching.  I'll admit, I've never talked about "stitching" before, and I wouldn't notice it at all unless it was terrible.  But just looking down right now at my chest, there are 3 thread-ends hanging off the stitching on the .. uhh .. button area.  (I'm sure there's a name for that part of the shirt, but I'm spacing on it right now.)

OK, so you might say to me "but Scott, this is so much less expensive than an IZOD -- it's a cheap shirt, so what do you expect?"

That's very true, however due to dress code changes at work one of my buddies just bought about 10 polos that were ten bucks a piece from Kohl's.  They look better than these shirts and the material is thicker.

EDIT:  I just checked with my friend, and the polos he got were Croft & Barrow brand.  At the time of this review, they're priced comparably (on sale) to these Joe's polos at kohls dot com.  Your mileage may vary as prices tend to change considerably.  But I've bought polos from Target as well that were cheap and better quality than these.  The point is that I know that there are decent quality yet inexpensive polos out there, and they're not these.

Annnnd, we have a small office with an open floor plan, so once I called attention to the shirt I was told that it "looks weird" and that if I "put the belt on the outside it would make a nice dress".  Just food for thought there.
summary: Too long, material is too thin, poor workmanship.

I Love Pretty Jewelry and this Wide Open End Silver Cuff Bracelet is Extremely Feminine and Beautiful!
The Filigree Vine Pattern is Perfectly Detailed and would be a a very nice accent piece for both day and nighttime wear.
It's made of heavy duty metal alloy and will hold up well to any adjustments made when putting it on and taking it off again.
My wrist is only 6" in circumference and this 1 1/2" wide  x 7 1/4" (with ends touching) Silvertone Cuff Bracelet is loose enough on me that it moves around freely on my forearm.
For me that is really not an issue, as I planned to gift it to my son's girlfriend who's wrist is a bit larger than mine.
It would definitively fit an 8" or larger wrist comfortably.
The Etched Detail of the Outer Edges and Center Strip are a wonderful accent to the Slightly Raised Silver Vines that grace the top and bottom bands.
Both the outer and inner sides of the entire cuff are Silvertone in color, but the way the Vines are slightly raised give this Cuff an Antiqued appearance.
Smitco LLC packages this Wide Open End Silver Cuff in a nice gift box that is sealed with a thank you sticker on the top of the box. They even wrap the cuff in tissue paper and set it on a bed of cotton batting so it won't get damaged in transit.
I received this bracelet at a discount in exchange for testing and review and I am giving it a Very High Recommendation!

reviewText: I am shocked at the quality of this ring, considering the price.  Even at 2 or 3 times the price, I'd be impressed.  It has a substantial weight to it that makes it feel solid and not cheap or flimsy or fragile. I am rough on rings, as I do a good bit of work using hand and power tools, carrying lumber and bricks, etc., and it has not gotten scratched at all. Not only is the metal strong and durable, but it has some sort of tough coating that really protects the wood inlay. I highly recommend this ring - you will not be disappointed!
summary: Incredible quality, durability and appearance at a ridiculous price!

reviewText:
I'm a US size 14 and I ordered the XXXL. I'm not sure the bottoms would have fit even if they'd been sewn properly; improperly aligned stitches made one leghole too small and the waist was TINY. Then, there was the bikini top: one cup was not completely sewn and was missing stitches. The other cup's insert was inserted so wrong that the cup was permanently inverted and sticking out awkwardly; no amount of steaming/ironing fixed it. The little knot in the middle of the cups was not sewn closed and the fabric was shredded.

Add all that to the customer "service" I received and I'll not be buying from them again. They offered me $3 (not a typo) refund and to just keep the item. When I protested at the $3, they said I could send it back for a full refund - but the label was a self-ship, postage-needed label. I'm not shipping a disfigured product back to CHINA on my own dime! SO not worth my time and money.
summary: I'm a US size 14 and I ordered the XXXL ...

They bought the biggest size they had (7 tall) and while the top fits perfectly, the bottoms are too short for her.  I figured being a tall they'd be fine (she's 9 but still wears size 7/8 tops & some bottoms).  My other daughter's PJs are a size 6 and the bottoms for the 7 tall and the 6 are exactly the same length.  I don't know if there was an error with the PJs being packaged (there is a miniscule tag hidden in the seam of the younger girl's that says "6" on it but no tag in the other pair of bottoms so I can't confirm if they sent me the wrong size bottoms or assume that a 7 tall doesn't need to be longer than a size 6 bottom).  So just be forewarned that if you get the 7 tall, there's a slight possibility that the bottoms will fit in girth but be capri-length.  My daughter is ok with it but I know it was a disappointment. If they hadn't been purchased back in August through my mum's Canadian Amazon account, we might have considered returning them.  I am going to see if there's a "contact seller" button to let them know even though we're not returning them.

reviewText: Really cute Christmas pajamas for a great price. I got these for my daughter to wear during the holidays. She is 2 1/2 and I ordered a 3t and it fits as expected, I also compared this 3t to other 3t pajamas and they are the same size, so I would say that their sizing is pretty standard. I washed these as soon as I got them, unlike other reviewers, I experience no bleeding at all whatsoever. The red did not bleed, I washed them on cold as I normally would. The material is very thin, shirt and pants, so don't expect these to be warm or like a thick cotton or anything. The waistband on the pants is not like the one in the picture, its just a regular waistband that is the same as the pants. The green is also more of a truer lime green, not as muted as in the picture. The stitching on the snowmen is great and my daughter loves it. Since the material is so thin, I can't imagine that these would last super long through wear and washing, but its perfect for the season! The pajamas shipped immediately and they arrived a day earlier than expected. Very pleased and happy with my purchase and with the seller.

reviewText:
This 1 1/2" x 1" Rose Gold Open Heart Necklace with by SmitCo LLC is Simply Stunning!
The 1 1/4" Rose Gold Plated Heart Shaped Charm features a Gorgeous 1/2" Multi-Faceted, Pin Set Crystal that Sparkles Like a Real Diamond when the light hits it!
The Left Side of the Heart is Smooth and Shiny while the Right Side is studded with 17 -  1/16" Multi-Faceted Crystals which Accentuate the Larger Stone Beautifully.
This Heart Shaped Charm with 1/2" Crystal is Securely Fastened to a 7/16" x 1/2" Puffed Heart, Rose Gold Plated Bale, Through which the 15" Flat Rose Gold Plated Chain is strung.
The Extremely Attractive Flat Rose Gold Plated Chain features a Lobster Claw Clasp on one end and a Chain Extender which offers 7- 1/8" links.
SmitCo LLC ships this Gorgeous Rose Gold Open Heart Necklace in a Shiny Silver Hologram Box, so it's ready for gifting ~ no wrapping paper required.
This Truly is an Eye Catching Necklace which is Sure to Please!
SmitCo ships quickly and offers Excellent Customer Service.
I received mine at a reduced cost in exchange for testing and review and am giving this High Quality Rose Gold Open Heart Necklace, as well as the company that sells it, my Highest Recommendation!
summary: This 1 1/2" x 1" Rose Gold Open Heart Necklace with by SmitCo LLC is Simply Stunning!

reviewText:
It had the drawstring neckline I was after, which was awesome, and you can't beat the price... but the color wasn't anything like I was expecting.  The picture depicts a deep maroon color, and what I received was something pinkish-red.  The fabric itself is a stretchy poly knit, which has a little too much "hang" for my liking.  It's not heavy to wear, but the material is too heavy for itself and will kind of just hang straight down and be a little clingy.  I'm 5'3", 150 lbs and have a 28-inch waist, 38-inch hips, and I didn't like the way it hung over my hips.  If' you're looking for something breezy and light... keep looking.  :(

The material edges are finished with overlock stitching - which is unnecessary with a knit poly fabric such as this, so I suspect the maker did this as a decorative measure.  I don't care for that kind of finishing on material edges, so that was another mark against this particular garment.  Fortunately, returns for this item are free, and Amazon makes it super-easy to do... so, back it will go.
summary: I wanted to love this so much.

It's about what you could expect for the uber-cheap price, but no better.  With an underbust, cincher, or tunic, it would go perfectly as part of a Renaissance Faire costume, but I wouldn't wear this as a standalone dress for anything else, probably not even as a summer outfit.  The cloth is super comfy and moves easily, so that's a bonus, but the construction itself is on par with something sewn at home, especially around the drawstring top which cinches in the back.

This dress might actually be a steal if you have any sewing skills whatsoever, because with only minor stitching to improve where the drawstring feeds through, and possibly some minor strengthening of the weaker seams, you'd get a much better looking product with pretty awesome fabric at a very low price.

Unfortunately, my dress came with a very tiny stain at the bottom of the skirt.  It looks like a bleach or chemical spot, and it wasn't worth my time returning it.  I'll probably wear it next time I go to RennFaire since I won't be worried about mucking it up, but it's quite useless to me otherwise.
summary: Only Good as a RennFest Dress

***I would personally recommend these as driving gloves, which is what I mainly use them for***

I went with the black gloves & cashmere lining.
I went with a size 8.5 after measuring my hands, and the sizing was spot on.
At first they were a little bit tight, mainly in the finger length, but the leather broke in after a week or two of use and now fit perfectly to MY hands!
(I'm a 6'1" male with decent size hands, not overly large or small, and can comfortably wear "large" size gloves or tightly wear "medium" size gloves.)

The inside lining is extremely soft and they are the most comfortable gloves I've ever tried!

These gloves are WAY better than my old pair of $60 Calvin Klein leather gloves in every aspect.
They are a nicer fit for my fingers, way more stylish, lining is more comfortable, and the overall quality of the leather and stitching is better  (could see these selling for close to or over $200 in a store!)

For me, these gloves work PERFECTLY for driving because my hands stay warm long enough in the cold mornings while my car warms up, yet they don't overheat my hands once the car's interior has fully warmed up.
I would say around 45F (7C) and above these gloves work great to keep your hands warm.
They don't have too heavy of a lining though, so my hands never overheat or sweat even while the interior of my car is 75F (24C)

My old CK leather gloves had over-wide fingers which weren't even long enough in the fingers when I closed my hand to make a fist! Over-wide fingers made my old gloves feel clunky doing things like grabbing things from pockets, using my keys, and even driving. I always felt it was easier to take a glove off, do what I need, then put the glove back on... ANNOYING!
These new gloves have a nice tighter fit in the fingers AND are still long enough to not cramp my fingers when I close my hand, making a fist! (once I broke in the leather after a week, of course) This makes it so I DON'T feel like taking these gloves off to do things!!

One thing to know is that they aren't that great for colder weather around freezing temperatures and below, you'll probably find yourself putting your hands in your pockets to keep them warm after a couple minutes.

They have held up very well so far after two and a half months I've had them, with nearly every day use.
(used the gloves all winter when out and about & still using them as driving gloves)

The leather shows some wear in the fingers after this much use, but not enough to notice unless you look up close at the leather.
I would guess that they should last me through a full year of driving, but I'll update my review if they start falling apart before then.

I have and will continue to highly recommend these gloves to friends, family, and everyone else.
By far the best gloves I've ever used/seen for the price! (I paid $33.99 for these gloves)

reviewText: I bought the black touchscreen gloves. These gloves don't look anything like the pictures - see the unedited, real-life photos that I've uploaded. The gloves also did not fit correctly. I bought 2 sizes: 8.5 and 9 and both were loose on the hand - I am normally a medium and unfortunately, neither worked. In addition, there was extra material on the finger tips, making for a baggy fit. The gloves are also very thin and I doubt they'll be good for the NYC winters. reviewText:
These. Gloves. Are. Awesome.
I got them for winter because I hate big puffy winter gloves. These are probably one of the most high quality things I've ever had. Lambskin leather and cashmere lining make it incredibly soft but also tough enough for daily use. Plus they look ridiculously cool. And yes, I can still touch screens!

So comfortable and very fitted. Looks like I'm wearing a tailor made glove. I am not into fashion, but people in Quebec (the trip I bought them for) kept commenting on these nice gloves... bizarre!

Be sure to refer to their sizing chart... that made all of the difference (rather than having to return and try again). Be smart, take the time and know your size first!

Lastly, works wonderfully with the Samsung S5.

reviewText: These glove get the job done and I don't plan on replacing them, but they sure didn't blow me out of the water either. They give you some decent dexterity which was my main focus.  They also give you good grip, which is nice. They aren't as warm as I was hoping but if I wasn't outside for extended periods or digging in the snow they worked fine. My one complaint is that I like a little extra material at the wrist to tuck into my jack. These gloves had a bit of material but it wasn't snug to my wrist (by design) and wasn't long enough to tuck into my jacket without it constantly escaping.  I realize this was probably intentional to make the glove more fashionable, but it's something I've noticed and would fix.
summary: Meets most of the criteria I want in a pair of gloves

reviewText: Beautifully made

I have smaller hands, so the usual department-store fare doesn't really work for me. I wanted to get a nice set of leather gloves for the winter and so I came upon these. Long story short: get them, they are awesome.

They are very stylish, comfortable, and well made. The leather and cashmere are high quality, same with the stitching. They fit correctly, as long as you follow the sizing guide (which they seem to have updated to show the actual measuring size) and are capable of measuring your own hand correctly. They are very warm and work well in temperatures just below freezing. Do not expect them to perform in single-digit or sub-zero temperatures. A lot of the reviews on here seem to have unrealistic expectations of what one layer of leather and cashmere are capable of doing. Basically, ignore the whiners.

The only thing that could be considered a downside is that the touchscreen fingertips are not always responsive (especially when it's near freezing). I did not buy the gloves for this reason, though. Using a touchscreen with gloves is awkward no matter what. As such, I don't consider this a true mark against the gloves.

Perfect! The gloves are soft, supple leather, cashmere lining is delightful. Most importantly, as advertised they work on a touch screen, and well (my partner can text with them on). I had miscalculated the size (might suggest trying a half size up here) but my exchange was smooth and fast. Zero complaints, very, very pleased with the quality of the product.

False advertisement. Not nappa leather. Chinese product made in china. Made of regular lambskin leather.

summary: made in china with lambskin not nappa. false advertisement

The sleeves surprisingly seem disproportionally loose for the style shown in the photo and I don't have stick arms.  The length fit fine for my height (just above the knee) but likely would be short ie mini skirt on anyone taller (I'm 5' even).

Would I purchase again?  Yes, but just be aware of the weird proportions - loose sleeves, short skirt.

reviewText:
EDIT:
One year later, and I love this dress!

-------------
Original Review:

I love this dress! It's my go-to for maxi dresses.

Pros:
1. Slimming! 'The multi-color jewel toned print is particularly slimming from the side. 'The Pink Peacock is not as slimming.'
Im not sure if the pictures that I took show this, but there you go

2. Versatility. I can wear it to work (with a bandeau) or out in the evening.

3. Beautiful. The two patterns I got really are beautiful.

4. Does not wrinkle. Great for travel.

5. Enough hip room/isn't clingy.

Cons:
1. The arms are way too tight.

2. The dress is way too open in the front. It is so open that I constantly have to look down to re-adjust, or the world can see my bra. This is even with a safety pin. (The photos are taken with safety pin.)

3. Too short!  It is ankle length. I usually wear this with wedges, but they are just too short.
I find that my silhouette is best elongated the high heel is covered 3/4th of the way. This dress does not come close to that.

For reference:
Height: 56"
Weight: 140-145
size: medium

This is a great dress! I wear it casually but think you could use some of the other patterns, especially black, for dressier occasions. I bought the jewel tone. And yes, with 2 granddaughters in college, I bought one for each!

I really liked this dress but was disappointed once I tried it on. The sleeves are way too tight and the material doesn't "give." I'm 5'7, weight 135lbs. and 36B. The dress fit perfectly in the length and everywhere else except for my upper arms. And my arms are not huge for my body by any stretch of the imagination. They're normal sized. If your arms are on the thinner side, this will undoubtedly work for you. The only way you're gong to know is by trying it for yourself. It really is a pretty dress.
summary: Pretty dress but upper arms are too tight....

This was purchased as a gift for a 12 yo who loves wolves. I haven't given it to her yet, but it is awesome. It is thick, plush, and feels nice. It's not super soft, but good quality, and a good size. I would say it fits 10 yo to small adult. It fits me and I'm 5' 4".  My 8 and 6 yo both love it too. It has a zippered pocket on the inside, which would fit money, credit card, iPod, maybe even a small cell phone - like iPhone without a cover. Mine hasn't shed at all. The con, and it is a big one- the horrible chemical smell. Not just the stuck in a plastic bag smell. Strong and irritating, almost like turpentine! The kind of smell that says, no screams: Made in China.  I have had it for over a week, and only after having it outside for several days and wiping it down 2-3x with a damp soapy rag has the smell gone away. I am lucky that I ordered it early enough to be able to do that. I considered shipping it back, but since I had the time, I figured I'd try. I will update after I give the present and see what the 12 yo thinks. Not everyone mentioned the smell, so maybe I was just unlucky :(

reviewText: Amazing canvas quality and looks impressive.
The bag is in great condition, though I did think I would be getting a brand new one. It clearly had been returned by someone else as there were some things left inside.
No it didn't meet my expectations. It's to small and the fabric it's kind hard. I like to return it.

I used this for a weekend trip as a carry-on (no baggage handlers touched the bag, only I did, so there was no roughhousing). Granted I packed it fairly full, but I was still able to zip it up, so it wasn't over-packed, mostly just clothes, nothing super heavy (no books, hiking boots, etc.) After only one airplane ride I am very disappointed. Here's why:
1. The color is more blue than grey (almost looks denim) but this wouldn't have been a deal breaker for me, had it not been for the serious quality issues below..
2. The magnetic snaps don't hold the front pockets closed.
3. By the time I arrived at the security checkpoint for my return trip, I was holding this bag like a baby. The rivets holding the shoulder strap had popped free, and the canvas had torn. The should strap was held on by only a few stitches-- and the small hand straps followed in short order. By that time they were all extremely lose. If this bag had gone through multiple trips over the course of a few years, I would chalk this up to normal wear and tear, but this is not the case. This bag arrived at my house 1 week ago today, and has been on a single trip to Florida as a carry-on. Now I have a bag with no usable straps!
4. If you'll notice in the description above, the seller asks you to email them if there is a problem with the product BEFORE posting a review... I can't find an email anywhere! Not on the sellers page, my order history, or the the description above (how hard would it have been to include in the description above?) I'm not going to waste 15 minutes looking for contact info-- I'll just return through amazon. I will try and post some photos of the damage before I return it.
Durable and Esthetically Beautiful

It's hard not to like this bag, especially for the price. Great value. More interior pockets than I expected, which is a nice surprise. The material is nice and heavy, but not too much. Can't think of anything I don't like.
summary: It's hard not to like this bag

reviewText: very thin and not flattering

Push Up Tankini is probably a bit of a misnomer.  There isn't really much for support or "push up".  It is cute on, and will be good for laying by the pool.  Just don't plan anything very active in it - if you have an ample bust you will end up giving someone a show.

I was pleasantly surprised by this suit. I'm 6' tall and finding an inexpensive suit just never happens, it seems.  I'm normally a size 10 or 12 if that helps, and this suit fit just fine. It's also long enough for my long frame. I normally spend up to $100 for a suit and yes, there is a difference. The material on this suit is cheaper and the cups are thin as can be--there is no pushing up to be had here. The "pushing up" is actually "pulling up" from those straps.  But this is a $25 suit. It's perfect for just a spare, cheap suit to have for vacation--which is exactly why I bought it.  I have not worn it in the pool yet so whether it falls apart upon contact with chlorine is yet to be seen... but it's comfortable and if you just want a simple, cheap suit that looks nice--this could work for you.
summary: Cheap material, great price--Still a great suit.

reviewText: I like the wallet fast shipping

I finally qualified for my Player King of New York City card, placed it delicately into my wallet, and then immediately realized that this simply wouldn't do. The brilliant glow of the card seemed dampened by old, overstuffed wallet (from the George Costanza collection). This dingy wallet was way too large, way too bulky. I had to find something thinner, more sleek, and more worthy of holding the credentials I had worked so hard to obtain. That's when I stumbled upon the Hammer Anvil Men's Genuine Leather Slimfold. I'm sort of in awe that this wallet costs eight dollars. Sure, it looks a little cheap at first, but after it wears in, it's fine. I've examined the stitching with my jeweler's glass for flaws. I have found none. So the quality is perplexing when I consider the money I spent, but there's something even more amazing about this wallet: the design. This is, quite simply, the best-designed wallet for my needs I've ever seen. I'll break it down. This is the perfect wallet design for urban types. I am always in a city (could be San Francisco, New York, London, etc.). I must have a front-pocket wallet. This wallet has the best arrangement of pockets I've seen while maintaining its slim profile. There's a clear pocket for credentials/ID. There are three card pockets for your debit card, your bank credit card, and your AMEX Black. There's also a larger slot behind these cards where you can stash the ancillary cards you rarely use, like insurance cards, medical marijuana ID's, various underground poker room membership cards, and the like. The kicker is there's an equally large slot on the outside that's perfect for all your rail passes and hotel room keys. The bill area is large enough, but keep in mind that fewer large bills will maintain the slim profile more than many small bills. I'd pay a real wallet maker lots more money if they created a wallet with this design, but they don't, so you should just buy 20 of this one.
summary: The brilliant glow of the card seemed dampened by old

reviewText: thank

I've had this wallet for a couple weeks. I was impressed by the quality of construction, packaging, and layout. The leather feels solid and durable, and this wallet has a waterproof lining.

I really liked the pocket arrangement--it was more convenient and intuitive than other slimfold wallets I have tried. It worked perfectly for a few bank cards, ID, a few bills, and a membership card or two.

The leather is a little thicker than slimfold wallets I have tried, and the waterproof lining is a nice touch. Both of these make this wallet a quality accessory. However these nice additions do come with a price: adding a bit of thickness to this wallet

I feel this is a top-notch wallet and one that all but the most super-slim-wallet-fanatics should be very happy with.

When I opened the shipping bag, my whole apartment smelled bad. This product gave off a strong chemical smell that reeked for more than a week. I placed it in a sandwich bag filled with baking soda and rice to get rid of the smell, but the smell still seeped through the bag. Finally after almost two weeks, the smell is almost gone. I will know if it's useful in a few days when I use it.
summary: Strong chemical odor. Takes more than a week to wear off.

reviewText: This is the thinnest wallet I have ever used, yet it holds everything that I has stuffed in my old over grown wallet.  Very thin leather, but well assembled and quality.  I expect to get a few years of wear out of this with no problem.

Great wallet

This is a very nice "slim" wallet and is well constructed.  The built-in RFID blocking feature is very nice to have to protect your cards from data thieves.  I tested it at a local supermarket to confirm that it works and it does indeed work.  The leather is soft and supple yet firm enough to keep your wallet from curling at the corners or flopping around to bend your cards.  If you are looking to switch from a bulkier wallet and slim it down enough so that you don't feel it when you sit down or even to keep it in your front pockets, this wallet will do the job for you.  It also has pockets behind the card slots if you need to store additional cards, cash, etc.  I was surprised how good the quality is for the price.  After using this wallet for a few months, I don't know if I could go back to my old ones.  Just an all around solid wallet.
summary: Tired of your big bulky wallet? Try this one

reviewText:
I didn't realize this was a custom made dress so I didn't get my measurements to them, but they contacted me to get them. The dress came out beautifully. And the craftsmanship was well beyond anything that I expected! Normally, when you buy a dress for under $100 at a department store, the seams are cheap and manufactured and the material is low quality; but this dress was flawlessly stitched and the materials are high quality. The lace felt soft to the touch. The border on the lace was perfectly attached. The bodice was double lined. The interior had reinforced boning and shaping.

I have literally NEVER left a review online before, but this dress was so amazing and of such high quality that I had to. I know you have no reason to trust my review above anyone else's, but this product is quality enough that I took time out of planning my wedding in under 4 months to write a review. (Other brides, you KNOW that means this was something special.)
summary: Above and Beyond in Quality, Service, and Material

reviewText:
I ordered this to use as a pill keeper to attach to my keychain so I can always keep my migraine medication with me.  I love it.  For those who want to use it for keeping an emergency pill on hand, I would suggest you carefully measure the pill to make sure it will fit inside this container. The interior part of the container measures 7mm in diameter, or a little over 1/4".  I had to remove the pill from it's foil package and wrap it in clear plastic wrap in order to protect the pill and also allow it to fit inside the container.  The depth of the hole down inside is maybe 1 inch but I just eyeballed that part of it so that's not an exact measurement of the depth.  The loop at the top seems to be sturdy, and hopefully this will last a long time.
The reason I do not like the typical cylinder shaped pill keepers is that they are too big to fit easily into the pocket of my snug jeans.  This one, however, fits nicely into the pocket along with my car key, and for that, I'm willing to put up with some compromise in terms of the inside dimensions of the container (it's smaller than typical pill keepers).
summary: I love it. For those who want to use it ...

reviewText: GET THIS! Here's everything you could want to know first IMHO: CONSTRUCTION - With baby soft medium to heavy weight jersey fabric, I like this tagless, logo-free adult-sized onesie / jumpsuit because it's comfy, stylish and fun. You will smile wearing it. Great value but the black interior is subject to some shedding (I recommend washing inside out once before wearing - especially if it is not exactly "new" as my first shipment clearly wasn't).  I found the kangaroo pockets in front to be barely large enough, but the zippered side pockets very nice for my phablet. SUITABILITY: I wanted it primarily for a one piece pajama / sleepwear on chilly nights but it looks so fly, I've proudly worn it to the mall and earned rave reviews. Might be too warm for some in the summer. While the long center zipper goes low enough for #1 (ladies, I don't know), I'm gonna speak to my tailor about adding a drop seat / flapjack for #2. CAVEAT: Buyer beware, as other reviewers have mentioned, I too found this item to be oddly-sized despite purchasing a size larger than my expected. At 5'9" 175 lbs, an M had short sleeves that stopped above my wrists, an uncomfortably snug crotch, a tailored waist (my midsection is flat), and a small child-sized hood -- yet extra long legs that bunch at tight ankles. Ugh. SELLER: Pleased to report all is well in the end with kudos to the seller for exceptional personal attention to earn my satisfaction. CONCLUSION: From an M to an XL replacement, I've settled at this twice larger size in anticipation of shrinkage over time. As of now: the XL sleeve length is good (if a touch long); the legs are superduper long; the waist is better suited for a teletubbie but hopefully after a good washing and heated drying, the fit will be as close to perfect as I can ask. Recommended.

Let's address the size issue right off the bat.  These socks have extreme stretch.  To tell you how much, I wear a size 12 extra-wide shoe. They fit perfectly including around the heel (which totally surprised me)!

So why did I risk buying them when the reviews about size were all over the board?

(1) I needed something to keep my toes warm at night when I'm sitting in the recliner. These cover my toes.

(2) I needed something I could wear inside my Crocs. Because I haven't been able to find any socks previously, I wear my crocs in the winter without socks. (I live in Atlanta, GA so we don't really have a hard, cold winter and I can tolerate the cold fairly well.)

(3) I have edema in my feet caused by a condition called "lymphedema."  Because of this, I needed something that didn't hit the curve in my foot on the top. These leave plenty of room and don't cut off the circulation by cutting in my skin.

(4) This condition also causes me to have swelling up my leg so wearing ankle socks is completely out of the question since they cannot go over the swelling.  (Even diabetic socks - if you are familiar with those - don't work!)

Roll all this together and it's IMPOSSIBLE to find socks.

When I put these on, I was shocked.  Even my husband couldn't believe they fit. They fit like a glove (a good glove).  The colors are just as bright and vivid as the picture shows. (I'm not afraid of color so I don't care if someone sees what the socks look like on the exposed heel since my Crocs are slide-ons.)

While all feet are different, if you have issues with socks (like I described above), these are a good solution.  Again, when it comes to size, you'll simply need to buy them and try them!
summary: Finally some socks that fit my size 12 extra wide feet!

Disclaimer: I recieved this product at a discount in exchange for my unbiased and honest review. This is MY use and opinion of this product.

I love wearing decorative socks, especially around the house.  I match my socks to my pajamas when I can or my lounge clothes.  I am also a bit picky about my socks.  I don't like them feeling real thin on my feet.  I also cannot stand for the seam to be too close to the tips of my toes.  It took me my entire childhood to get used to the seams being over the knuckle area.  Without actually seeing the socks first hand, and even sometimes then I am not 100% sure, I take a risk that I may not like the seams but I give them away if that happens.

These Womens Performance No Show Foot Liners - Cushion Hidden Socks - Size 9-11 (3-pk) by ComfortNFashion come all attached to one another with a cardboard band around the center that has the ComfortNFashion name and logo along with basic information about the socks.  All three pairs are attached together by a tag through the toes.  There were no marks from me cutting the tags and removing the clamps.

These socks are a one size fits most size.  They're 80% Acrylic, 10% Polyester, 5% Nylon, and 5% Spandex.  They're made in China.  They're machine washable in warm water with like colors.  They can be tumble dried on low.  Do not bleach.

The socks fit me perfectly.  The seams are just behind the nail bed of my toes and aren't noticeable for me.  The top of the socks have a built in elastic type of material in it.  The band is about 1/4 of an inch thick.  The socks are a bit thick.  They're thicker than normal socks but not extremely thick.

These socks do have left over threads on the inside from where the colors change out.  They're not as bad on the striped socks but there's a lot on the polka dotted socks.  The stripes on the striped socks don't match up perfectly on the underside but this is hardly noticeable.  On the polka dotted pair, there were a few strings in some of the light colored polka dots.  They end up being under the foot as well so not as noticeable.

These socks don't breath as well as I need for work so they're definitely not work socks but they're great for my off days and for around the house.  I love the vibrant colors and especially love the color schemes on them.  I have wash and worn them each of them quite a few times now and I would absolutely buy more as long as they're awesomely colored like these!

reviewText: First of all I love these socks! I only gave them 4 stars because they're not true no show socks, the color band is visible around the opening of the shoe. That being said, I've bought a number of no show socks trying to find the best fit for my Converse Shorelines, which has been hard because of the elastic that runs across the top of the foot in these shoes. Most no show socks don't come down far enough on the top of my foot. These definitely cover my foot to help with the discomfort caused by the elastic in my converse shorelines. There is no grip on the heel of these socks, but they still stay up. They are also a good thickness to help provide extra cushion for my feet. I will be ordering another set of these socks.
Comfortable and light weight!

These are the 4th brand of these types of liners/socks that I have tried and they are by far the best! All of the other brands I got from Target and they all slipped off my heels almost immediately. The most expensive pair (from champion) fell off the fastest. I'm only giving these 4 stars because ONCE I did have to put the sock on my right foot back on. But that was over an hour after wearing them! And to be fair, my right foot is smaller than my left foot, so that's not surprising. These socks/liners are probably twice the thickness of any of the other brands I've tried. I could tell that before putting them on. Love the bright colors and am so happy to have finally found a sock/liner that works so I can wear my cute new shoes! Highly recommend these!
summary: Twice the thickness as others AND THEY DON'T SLIP OFF! Highly recommend these!

But they are amazingly stretchy, and we got them all the way on, and they form fit her perfectly. They were well enough constructed to survive all the tugging we had to do to get them on, as well, and I was impressed. I was glad we had decided to add the petticoat over them. Tho the fit was complete and comfortable, I personally wouldn't have been comfortable with the hip area uncovered on her body type (other body types might be okay). And yes, she said they were warm. :)

I soaked them in baking soda and cold water for a few hours before their first wash. It took a few washes for the smell to go away. I'm 180 pounds, 5'4", and they were just a little long on my legs, but as I wear boots over them, I was happy for the extra length. There doesn't seem to be a clear front and back, but I noticed they fit more comfortable in my seat if the seam was sitting just behind my inseam line. I didn't experience any saggy crotch issues, which usually only happens if the tights/leggings are too small.

I wish they came in more colors, as MOPAS did NOT send the right size.
summary: Fits well and keeps me warm.

reviewText: These are very comfortable, warm and cozy. I ordered a size up from what I normally do in other clothes simply because they are leggings and I know they are naturally going to fit snug and I didn't want them skin tight (the size chart provided also supports this concept). I'm very glad I did. They fit exactly like I wanted them to, still form fitting, yet not skin tight and constricting. I did NOT notice ANY weird smell like some of the other reviewers noted. The one problem I've seen is that they get fuzz balls easily and I haven't even washed them yet. Also, in spite of the fuzz balls, I would order more in different colors IF they had them.  FYI:  My remedy for fuzz balls is a disposable razor. I lay the item flat and smooth all wrinkles and simply shave them off. It is a little time consuming, but it does remove the fuzz balls beautifully.
summary: Warm, cozy and very comfortable BUT they get fuzz balls terribly.

reviewText:
I was a bit worried by all the comments of the tights running short/small but was relieved when the packaging noted "improved sizing."  Now find that amusing.  Only ordered one pair, will not order again - at least not for my 5'1" body.  While the tights feel very soft and comfortable and presumably warm, I could wear these as an all-in-one.  The legs are a bit long, and I suspect that they will not bag after wearing for a short while.  But the real issue is the panty portion.  It is so long, I can pull it up to my shoulders! Something smaller than a "S/M" would be helpful for me.

So many of the cold-weather tights seem to have sizing complaints which really baffles me...  For the past 60 years I have worn tights and/or pantyhose on a routine basis, and if the label said "Small" I knew they would fit comfortably.  What is wrong with the cold weather manufacturers?
summary: While the tights feel very soft and comfortable and presumably warm

It's fine by me because I wear an S, but if you are taller than 5.5 and weigh more than 118 lbs this S/M might not be for you.
summary: great product for a good price

reviewText:
At first glance, I thought this would be a great product. Fleece lined tights, what could be better? The fit, that's what. I am petite, measuring about 5 foot 2 and about 120 pounds, give or take, with relatively even weight distribution--i.e. my butt isn't particularly large, nor are my gut/hips. The legs are too short for my legs (I'm obviously no giant) and the waist is too long. I don't know who the designers had in mind when they decided to include approximately a foot of fabric from where the legs end to the top of the waistband. The waist goes up to my chest, and the legs are barely long enough--I have to do quite a bit of pulling and adjusting to get the legs so the crotch is where it's supposed to be, and it always slides down so it's somewhere on my upper thigh. It's quite uncomfortable.

I didn't return them because I thought the legs would stretch with a wear or two, and after that had already washed them so I didn't even try to send them back. I'm lazy. That said, I WOULD NOT recommend this product to anybody...unless they have stubby legs and the torso length of a giant.

My only positive experience with these tights is that they are very, very warm and the lining is super soft. But that's not enough to outweigh the massive issues with fit.
summary: Absurd body proportions required to wear these.

Ok, so I get my shirts delivered today and immediately noticed that the size is not xxl but rather xl instead. This seems to be the case with every garment I've ordered that originates from the Chinese, they're always cheating American consumers one way or another & it's not worth my time to get into a dispute w/them about it because it's always a lengthy wait to get the right things from them. You won't get xxl so just ignore the option.
Anyway, I ordered them big because as you can see from the feedbacks from other consumers, they run small. In my case it didn't even matter because they sent me what they wanted to send me, I had no say. They definitely are tight like Spanx! Xl is more like a medium and the chest part is measured incorrectly because my man nips are exposed on both sides. Unlike the American & Japanese, they will not  measure things accurately and these are likely a cheap knock-off of a quality American brand.  The material used feels fine & the stitching looks good but I haven't put them through a rigorous real life test so we'll see.
They will fit a scrawny man or boy but if you're taller than 4' 10" and weigh more than 120 lbs you'll never fit these right.
I have to sit & stretch them by hand to even fit them & that's just annoying because they shrink right back to little kid size anyway.
Listen to these feedbacks about size & quality because you'll be sorry if you don't.

It fit well but it's a bit snug in the waist and gut, had I gotten it a size larger it would have fit perfectly.  The outside waist pockets are sewn shut, but the pockets are lined as they should be so they CAN be functional, just remove the stitching that holds them shut and you're in business.  The buttons are covered with matching fabric and constructed of brittle plastic so if they're stressed at all they WILL break.  It was my intention to replace the buttons with bronze buttons anyway so I'm not complaining, just letting others be aware of this possible problem area.  Overall, I am VERY pleased with this vest and I would definitely recommend it to anyone, just buy 1 size larger than you usually wear.

My kids are very involved in a local youth theatre and I am always on the search for costumes.  My daughter was recently in a production of Alice in Wonderland and was the Cheshire Cat.  She needed a purple vest.

I checked everywhere locally but could not find one anyway.  I found this one on Amazon.  The price was great and the only size Available was a size Medium.  She wears a women's medium but I wasn't sure how the men's size medium would fit.  This vest is a very nicely made man's vest.  It is a slick purple material on the front and balck on the back.  It has a strap/belt on the back to adjust.  This is a dressy vest so I could see this being used for a wedding or prom.  The vest fit her perfectly and worked great for this play.  She wore it for hours and hours the week of the play.  She moved around all over the stage and really put it to the test.  It still looks brand new!

I am including some pictures.  They are all taken during the play but it will give you an idea what the vest looks like.  I am very pleased with this vest.  It is definitely purple in color and I would order it again in a heartbeat.
summary: Great quaility and fit just like we needed!

The back adjustment, just like every other vest I own, doesn't stay put, a minor inconvenience. Buy according to your chest size. The construction is also on par with department store waistcoats I have bought, but I would watch the buttons. The vests also come with a spare button stitched on the inside rear.

WAY too small.  Not even remotely near what might be expected to be a 3XL size.  The vest itself would have been fine otherwise for the price.  No, it's not a premium quality vest.  But you wouldn't expect it to be for under 20 bucks.  It would be fine quality for a Halloween costume, stage play costume piece, under a suit coat for a Homecoming or a Prom, maybe even a wedding (as an usher, groomsmen,etc, not as the groom).  It's going to be the kind of quality that you'd want to wear as an accessory a time or two, but not one that you'll want to have as a timeless staple piece in your dress wardrobe or anything that would be able to stand up to everyday wear at work. It's obviously cheaply made overseas of very cheap fabric.  But that's what I figured I'd be getting for like $19.00.  I didn't expect luxury formal wear. But I did expect it to fit, or at least come close to fitting.  I know big and tall stuff is often a challenge and was prepared to work with it being a little small if it ran a little small.  I was way more than a little small, like probably would barely have fit a size Large.  I couldn't even use it for the Halloween costume I planned to use it for.

Not only was this item small, but it was about 3 sizes too small. When I put this on, the gap between the buttons and button holes is about 3 inches. Seriously, this 3X vest is more like a large in any shirt size. Beware...order MANY sizes larger than you think you need or if you are going by their measuring chart.

I wouldn't expect it to last the rest of my life if I wore it everyday, but it should hold out a number of years for how I intend to use it. Perhaps I do not know how to use the adjustable strap on the back properly, but it loosens with walking around. reviewText: It was a gift and they loved it!

I wanted something without leather that was also good looking and the Corkor wallet really filled the bill.  I got the 'rustic' color where it is light on the outside and darker inside. reviewText:
I bought this wallet for my husband. We are a vegan family and only purchase items that are vegan. This wallet is vegan and is really nice! it is made from cork, as its name indicates. Therefore, it is very lightweight. The wallet came ready to give as a gift. It was nestled in a cardboard box on top of shredded paper. Then, the wallet itself was wrapped in a paper covering and sealed with a sticker. It had a lovely presentation. The wallet exceeded our expectations. The cork is beautifully dyed a dark reddish brown on the outside. The inside is what I think is the natural color of cork. The two tones effect is really neat. My husband was excited when I gave him the wallet to open. He does not like to have a heavy wallet, and some vegan wallets made from faux leather are very heavy. This wallet is even lighter than the hemp one he is currently using! He is excited to switch all of his cards and money to the new wallet. I would definitely recommend and buy this wallet again. The craftsmanship and presentation are excellent! Just remember to recycle the cardboard packaging.
 I was provided this product for free or at a discount in exchange for my honest and fair review. I always aim to be 100% objective. All opinions are my own. I rely on reviews when I make purchases, so I definitely aim to be as objective as possible. I do not automatically give a five star review. I have to actually love the product. I am not required to leave a positive review in exchange for the product or discount. I hope this review has been helpful to you.

I was glad to see that wallet looks just as good in my hand, as it does in the picture.

summary: This is a great wallet. Even sturdier than expected

reviewText: Looks and feels very well made.

Excellent product from all standpoints. Beautiful color and craftsmanship. As a woodworker this wallet is perfect as making a walnut and beech wallet would be a bit difficult but this looks as if it's exactly what I had done!

** update **
Here we are well over a year in and it's still going strong. My husband takes it everywhere and is not super careful with it - it's still in great shape.
The only complaints we have is that the gold logo rubbed off fairly quick  (probably going in and out of his pocket) and at first the card slots were very stiff. It took some getting use to for him since it was so much bigger than wallets he has had before, but he still loves it.
***

My husband and I are both vegetarians. And this wallet is a nice, classy wallet without being made of animal materials, which is seemingly hard to find.

Right away I was very impressed with the quality of the materials and the craftsmanship. You could really tell that this was a nice wallet from handling it. The color of the cork and the texture all made it look quite classy.

Upon first observation my husband was a little nervous about the larger size of the wallet being that it seemed bigger than he had pictured. In fact, it is quite a bit larger than the US dollar bill, as shown in my photos. I believe that it's just going to take a little time to get used to having a bigger wallet than he was previously used to.

Early on, it does feel a little bit stiff getting cards in and out of the slots (particularly the second slot as the bottom slot completely covers it). This may just need to loosen up in time.

While It's too early to tell how well it will hold up to long term wear, we are pleased with what we have seen so far, as the craftsmanship is of such high quality. But we will come back to update if anything goes awry.

Bottom Line: This is a fine, classy looking larger wallet. As long as the size is something you can handle, I highly recommend it.

I purchased this wallet with a discount in exchange for giving my honest review of the product. The opinions expressed here are entirely my own.

I purchased this wallet and it only took two days to come in due to it being prime which helped. I also currently received cork vans as a gift and i fell in love with those so when i saw this i had to have it. I loved the fact that they had multiple different colors and combinations. I ordered the darker color on the outside and the lighter color on the inside. The only thing i wish this wallet had was  a special spot for my license but it really isn't a big deal. It does have two pockets for money so if your the type to split your bills up that would be a plus for you. I don't really mind it to much but it helps. The cork feels really nice in your hands and i have already received quiet a few compliments on the wallet. The only thing that worries me is how long the wallet is going to last with it being made of cork. And one thing that completely went over the top was the packaging. I was super impressed with how they did it. It was in a nice box and when you open it you cant see the wallet because it is wrapped in a paper type material and there is straw paper around it all. And on top of all that there was a mini card that was hand written that said Thank you. Super impressed with the service and the product. I am 100% with recommending this product to anyone for themselves or even for a gift. This would make a great gift! I received this product at a discount for an honest and unbiased review

reviewText: These shirts are great! Ultra-vivid, bold, patterns, exceptionally light weight, with silky comfort. I had never heard of this new material, Terivoile, but it's also called "artificial silk", and it does feel like silk. I suspect that Terivoile is the same as the La Leela brand's Likre. I have both fabrics and they feel the same to me. The sizing is perfect. Unfortunately for me, I am on the cusp between two sizes, so I can wear the larger size with a bit of extra room or the smaller size comfortably if I unbutton the bottom button so as not to pop it off when sitting. I love the feel of these shirts--I'm bought several. The only drawback, a minor one, is that they can be a bit sticky on hot, muggy days. Most of the time they simply feel super.
