Love the design on this shirt!  There are some things you should be aware of before ordering.  These shirts run small and are what would be considered Junior size and style.  I wear a Misses Small (4/6) and ordered up one size in this shirt to a Medium.  It barely fits, but will be okay.  If I was to order again I would get a Large.  The Neck is a "deep" V, but not too low.  The preshrunk ringspun cotton material is thin.  It is not like the weight of a Gildean or Beefy Tee.  The design is a rubberized heat-transfer print, not silk-screened. The placement of the design is low enough that part of it will be covered if you wear this shirt tucked in.  These are not necessarily bad things, just take them into account when ordering.  Order was shipped via Priority Mail.
summary: Size Up and Know What to Expect

reviewText: Great, soft, flattering. My new exercise shirt. More colors please. Long enough to cover the butt.

I am at the glorious stage of peri-menopause where I wake up in the night drenched in sweat.  Awesome Universe- thanks for that little gift.  I have been miserable at night and even had to get up a few times to change my clothes.  Then I discovered Bamboo... this shirt is so soft and stretchy comfy, I'm telling you, I will never go back to sleeping in a regular cotton shirt.  It wicks the moisture away and dries so quickly- I still get sweaty, but its so much more tolerable and I don't get drenched and I have not had to change my clothes at night since I made this purchase.  I usually wear an XL but I chose XXL because I like my sleepwear to be oversized and comfy and I'm glad I did.  I would recommend (if you also purchase bottoms) to order  a size smaller in the bottoms.  They are very large and roomy.  Overall, this is an excellent product.  The material is a bit thin, but its very durable and washes well.  I will definitely be buying more of these.

Hands down the most comfortable t shirts I own! Bought the charcoal grey and black and think I will wear them out!

Thankfully, they are very well made and the material is substantial. They also wash & dry well with no pilling - yay!! The colors did not bleed or fade either.

The material is so awesome! It feels smooth & soft against my skin. It is not see through, yet not so thick that it makes me hot.

The cut is great, too! It's cut for a woman's curves so it doesn't look boxy, yet it is not a skinny shirt. It flows like a great t shirt should.

Almost feels like pajama t shirt material, just way better made.

I'm not a fan of blue, so I hope they one day sell other color options because I'd love this t shirt in green, turquoise and pale yellow!!

They have a loose fit that hides sins, and the fabric is lusciously soft. I am so in love with this line that I just ordered a tank top in the same fabric. If I like it as much, I'll probably end up with several of those as well. What's next? The pants? I wouldn't be surprised!

reviewText: I made the mistake of trying to order this top from another seller. I won't do that again. This time I purchased it from the seller Fishers Finery and got exactly what I ordered. I love this soft, comfy shirt.

My new favorite t-shirt! I bought them in every color. Flattering and comfortable. I especially like the light gray and dark grey, but all of the colors are great. Perfect for working out, summer hikes, casual outings, lounging, etc. I wear the pink one as a PJ top because it matches a pair of PJ bottoms so well. I'm very picky about what I sleep in - has to be super comfortable and not to heavy or light. Love these!

I run a bit between sizes, and based on feedback here from others, I ordered the larger of the sizes I usually wear. The tee fits perfectly. I think I could have ordered either size and been comfortable. The material is cool and comfortable. The shape is flattering and correct. In other words, the seams are straight and there's no strange twisting. The v-neck hits at exactly the right place - not to low, not too high. The bottom of the shirt hits about at the mid-hip for me. I'm short, but even if I were several inches taller, the shirt would cover my mid-riff, even if I reached above my head. I've washed it 3 times now. I don't dry any of my clothes, so I can't speak for how it holds up in the dryer. However, it comes out of the washer the same color that it went in, and it hang-dries nicely. I really don't have anything but positives to say about it. I wish they came in prints.
The tee arrives in a nice box to keep it from arriving wrinkled and crumpled. Frankly, as tees go, it's pretty top-of-the-line. I'll buy the other colors.
summary: Nicest solid tee I've ever owned

reviewText: DO NOT BUY!!!! I wish I had read earlier reviews on this seller (SKOW). reviewText: I ordered two of these shirts--one in blue and one in gray heather. If I had only gotten the blue one i would probably be giving five stars. The material is super soft and comfy and clearly well made. I am 5'5", 34B, 125 pounds and I ordered small. The style is drapey, and so clearly meant to run on the large side. If I were to do it again I would buy x-small. The major problem I have is with the gray shirt. First, there is a very odd, somewhat unpleasant smell to the material, even after two washings. There is no discernible smell with the blue shirt, so it must be that the material is slightly different. Additionally, the gray shirt, though the same size, is WAY larger than the blue. It is comically large--fits me the way an x-large usually would. It hangs well past my bottom. It reminds me of a maternity shirt. I have included a photo showing the size discrepancy. So, I guess it is hit or miss with these shirts. I would definitely be returning the blue shirt if I hadn't already washed it and worn it once. I guess it will be a sleep shirt.

reviewText: Softest most comfortable tee shirt I've ever worn. Great for lounging, workouts etc. Fabric is amazing to the touch!
Fits very comfortably and breathes. I'm glad I spent the extra money on it.
This is sooo comfortable. VERY happy with it! Thank you!
This is so soft it amazes me.  I love it.

I've purchased four of these tees because of the quality, fabric and fit.  Super comfortable and looks dressy under a jacket or casual by itself.  The bamboo rayon dries quickly and doesn't retain odors, great for the gym or for travel. The cut is what some would call boxy, but it drapes nicely and that works best on my body type.  Anyone wanting a tighter fit should definitely downsize.

I am very picky about my clothes, and this was a pleasant surprise.  The material is unbelievably soft and stretchy, and it drapes nicely.  I ordered two in XXL and loved them, even though they were a bit baggy---because comfort is far more important than style to me.  Yet they look far better and feel far more comfortable than the men's t-shirts that otherwise fill my closet.  However, there was a dearth of available colors in the XXL  so I took a risk and ordered  a couple in XL.  The XL fits me a bit better---less baggy---while still maintaining a good drape and comfort.

I like the v-neck too:  It's perfect in that it's not too deep, and for a large-busted gal like me it breaks up the space between my face and my chest very well without exposing a lot of skin.  The length of the shirt is great too---not too short, not too long.

I could probably stand even another inch or so on the sleeve length, but it's not too bad as is.  They are not "cap sleeves", which I detest because I have always had big arms, even in my younger and skinnier years.

Overall I love these shirts.  They have the comfort level of pajamas, but the appearance of "out-in-public" clothes. I can even dress these up by pairing them with a skirt.

P.S. I tried some similar tees from another brand (Texere) because they had more color selection but their fit was too snug for my taste (and I didn't like the round neck---that was when I realized shallow v-necks were the better look for me) and I sent them back.

I simply love this fabric, so much so that I purchased another V-neck Tee and 3 Nightgowns.  Very comfortable and for those suffering from Hot Flashes, FYI, These are made with bamboo, a natural cooling fabric.  It really works, trust me.
Very comfortable tee and true to size.

I should have paid more attention to other reviews.  I ordered my usual XL, and it was just too big.  But I loved the feel of the fabric so much I decided to use the original one to sleep in, and order a size down.  It fits perfect, and feels so good against my skin.

So soft and comfortable. Great quality.  Washes well.  More styles please. Thank you for making such a great garment.
G-d Bless!

reviewText: Love the material, color, neckline. I am 5'3" and most vneck tshirts are too low. Runs slightly big but I like loose fit.

Its nice to find a tshirt thick enough that layering isn't necessary! They run big. This is not a form fitting shirt, length is to bottom of my rear. I'm 5'6" 135lbs. Small fits me best. Fits nice in shoulders and bust (36B) yet loose in tummy area.

Unlike other Tees it'll have me hot,the material would become itchy BUT not these! It runs a bit large so order a size down.

These Tees are comfortable and feel cool. They have a silky feel to them.  I recommend highly.
It fits really well around my chest area and gets drapey towards the bottom. Very comfortable and soft, I wear mine all of the time. I got a couple of colors and I am very happy.

I'm a fibromyalgia sufferer, I also have diagnosis of RA (rheumatoid arthritis). Oftentimes my skin feels like I'm itching, burning, tingling, aching where the seams of garments meet my skin as though I might be cut with them. So finding garments to be comfortable and if fashionable and excellent quality is a total sell for me!

The FF brands stand out with the moment you receive them with the high quality packaging, it's something that you just know is "the good stuff" by looking at it.

I opened the t-shirt and tried it on, as soon as I touched it, I knew it would be great for me because it's like heaven in a tee shirt! Mind you, I received it during a flare up so I had been suffering the two nights prior with severe itching and feeling like there were shocks in my skin, also aching. The touch of this shirt on my shoulders felt like it may have even given me relief from my symptoms. Now of course there's no pain med in the tee, it's not some miraculous shirt, it doesn't have a super hero capability but it's perfect for me with these issues! I'm sure it was the shirt in part because its so soft, lightweight and it's the next best thing to being naked!

Now if I must have anything to say in a constructive light, they're not form fitting, they're your regular style-boxed like shirt, if you're looking for figure flattering- not the one! But the comfort and quality makes up for it so much! I wore this shirt two days in the same week and I never do that! Washed of course and by hand but I'm not one to repeat clothing in the same week unless it's pjs and I rarely wear those.

Disclaimer I received this product at a completely complimentary rate, at no cost to me in exchange for my honest review based on my experience with the product.

This t-shirt is made of a nice soft material so it feels great, it's very comfy, and fits well on my potato size body. It's not form fitting which work well for me because I like fluid tops. I really like the gray color which is perfect because it's not too light or too dark in color. I haven't washed it yet but I'm hoping it doesn't shrink because I think the size & fit is perfect the way it is for me. If it shrinks, I'll update this review to say so.

reviewText: These tees are super soft and comfortable.

First I have to say that I am very picky with the clothes I wear, not because it has to be stylish but because it is a must that it be comfortable to wear. That said, this is one of the b est clothing purchases I have made in a very long time!!! I am currently a bit on the heavy side and my biggest worry is that this shirt would fit too tight as most nowadays are, being that they are making them longer but narrower. However this shirt was only long enough to cover my waistline, even when i would raise my hand but not so long that it covered my behind. The fit was boxy but for my type this is perfect! I have never purchased any bamboo-made clothing before but it is something I will definitely wear now. The material is sssssssooooooooooooo soft, it is unbelievable how much you will enjoy just feeling it with your hands, let alone wearing it!!! I used this for the first time for an impromptu road trip and it truly held up. Even 5 hours later, the shirt was still soft and supple to the touch!!!!

reviewText:
From the moment the package arrived (on time, btw) I knew this company was going to be incredible.  This shirt arrived in a beautifully presented navy blue box.  It was a thin box but long and at first I didn't think a shirt was in there, but it was all part of the presentation.  When the box was opened, the shirt was carefully packaged inside with an information card that gave details about the company, its history, the fabric for the shirt as so on.  While this shirt isn't an expensive one, the presentation would make any receiver think you spent a fortune for it.

The shirt itself is so beautiful and incredibly soft.  Im a size 8 regular and ordered a medium size Chalk Blue.  The color is faint but a perfect amount of pigment to be versatile.  The feel of this shirt is so amazing its hard to describe. I would buy this shirt (and product line) again and again. I received this product at a discounted price for my honest review.

reviewText:
Fishers Finery ecofabric Women's V-neck Tee.

Can I say that I am absolutely in love with this Tee.  I am a tshirt wearer.  I rather wear a tshirt than anything else.  So hear is what I like about this Tee.  EVERYTHING!!!

Pros:

1)  The softest T I have every felt/wore.
2)  The size is just right.  I order and wear and XL and this fits me perfect.
3)  Love that it is ecofriendly.
4)  Made of ecofabric (organic cotton and organic bamboo
5)  It is well constructed.
6)  Slits on the side for a little extra room.
7)  The packaging is the best I have ever, ever seen.  Nice presentation.
8)  Great price.

Cons:

I love this shirt.  If I could give it more than 5 stars I would. I truly recommend this shirt.  Because of the superior quality, I can see this item become a luxury Tee and the price point go way up.  Get it while it's a $20 bill alert.

I recieved this product for my honest unbiased review and that is what I have given.

reviewText: I have never been a fan of ordering clothes online since you can't get a real feel for the item. With that said, this is the first piece of clothing I have purchased from Amazon. I am pleased to say that this T-shirt is really great. This is easily the best t-shirt I own. The T-shirt arrived in an individual box and is ready to be gifted if you choose. However, this shirt  is SUPER soft and comfortable and you're going to want to keep it for yourself. It almost has a silky feel to it. You could really feel that the T-shirt is made with high quality fabric. The shirt fits well and true to size. The shirt has very good coverage and is really breathable. There is a slight bit of wrinkling to the shirt if you look up close, but nothing you would have to press to wear. Disclaimer: I received this product at a discounted rate or free so that i could evaluate, test and review the product to the best of my abilities and to submit my honest and unbiased opinion and experience. I am under no obligation to provide a positive review and receive no incentives for doing so. My review is sincere and I hope that it is helpful to others.

Fisher's Fienry prodcued items in this range in excellent quality, most of it owneing up to a fabulous fabric I have yet to find elsewhere. I own 10-12 piced in this line as the fabrick is not flimsy, or too heavy and stiff. The fabric drapes and flows beautifully and has a silk hand. You will be so glad you got anyhting from this line. I worry somehow they will discontinue or run out of fabric one day. I paid full price for this item so this is an honest review
summary: Beautiful fabric, amazing feeling. A full price review

reviewText:
Fisher's Finery is is now one of my favorite clothing lines! I usually pretty nervous every about buying clothing online because I'm plus sized and nothing ever seems to fit quite right. But since I recieved this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion, I figured I would give it a try. So glad I did!
I love the color, it is a beautiful dusky blue. The color is rich and even throughout the garment. The stitching is superb, all of the hem lines are even and I see no evidence of fraying or loose threads. I love the v-neck as well, sometimes the depth is not deep enough or it's too deep. This v-neck sits in the "goldilocks" spot, just right, I don't have to worry about bending over and flashing the world.
The material is very lovely, not too light yet not heavy by any means. The fit is amazing, I am normally a size 16 or xxl depending on brand and Fisher's xxl fits me like a dream. There is a soft drape that is very flattering and I think this shirt could easily be dressed up or worn casually. I also love that the company strives for organic and sustainable products, honestly have absolutely nothing negative to say about this fine shirt. This is the second product I have recieved from Fisher's Fineries and will certainly not be my last.
Please not all opinions are based on my own experiences with this product.

I thought this would just be a plain t-shirt but its far from it. It is a plain v-neck but it feels so good. Its a nice soft material thats also sort of stretchy. Its so soft and does feel like a t-shirt you could just get from wal-mart or a clothing store. I ordered the heavenly pink in an x-large and its a nice soft light pink color and it fit me perfectly. I really like this shirt because its so soft and feels so good against my skin. I would definitely recommend this shirt because of how soft it is. I received this shirt at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

reviewText: I love the feel of the bamboo fabric. Thank you!

I started looking into bamboo clothing because I will be going on an extended bicycle tour soon.  Cotton does not moisture wick, and odor soaks in easily.  Polyester is better at wicking moisture away then cotton, but odor soaks in quicker than cotton... and nylon is similar to polyester.  In life, so far, cotton has been the go to, but ***bamboo*** [viscose] is antimicrobial, wicks away moisture, and if I desire, I can wear it for a week straight through working out and it won't collect odor anywhere near the strength of the other three combined.  It truly is one of the softest, most durable, best properties fabric I've ever tried.  Fisher's Finery was a perfect shirt for price, comfort, colors, and v-neck style... however in my needs, a slightly longer sleeve and athletic fit was desired.... so I returned.  You won't be disappointed if you by this shirt, although I would suggest looking at their size chart, and sizing down.  Thank you :)

These shirts are GREAT!! I've bought 4 so far, as they fit me just right and are SUPER soft! Lately, shirt sizes seem to be shrinking and getting all sorts of wacky, with narrowing and lengthening being an issue. I am short-waisted, narrow-waisted, with wider hips and bust and this shirt style fits me just right. Just long enough to cover the waistline of pants/skirts, but not so long that they are dragging below the crotch/butt area. I do not like my shirts to fit that way, and so many are made too long and you either have to stretch them around your hips, or bunch them up. Often, this makes your waist look thicker, too. Ugh! I also like the length of the sleeves. Long enough for a nice coverage, but not so long as to be matronly or hot. Lots of shirts these days skimp on sleeve length, making them unflattering unless you've got very toned arms. The V-neck is just the right depth and angle. Again, so many other shirts I've bought are quite low-cut (even when that's not really the intention).

I wear this shirt to the gym with yoga pants and, I wear it to work with a nice skirt. I LOVE that they are made from sustainable materials (yay, healthy bamboo and organic cotton!), and I'd hope they're made in a "fair trade" type of factory. Although I do think they are a good value, I wish they were a bit less expensive (they are my most expensive shirts!). They wash and wear well (sometimes, I hang them to dry), but they will take longer than a polyester shirt to dry. I know this, because I hand-washed and hung-dried both on a recent trip overseas, and this took much longer to dry.

Overall, I highly recommend this shirt. Fishers Finery, please keep making this style, and add a few more colors, too! Royals: red, purple, or blue? Even dark teal, maybe??

I rely on reviews to help me make informed buying decisions,. I hope this review helped you. :)
summary: Comfy, soft, great fit, excellent fabric!!

reviewText:
Quality V-neck made of incredibly soft and comfortable material. This shirt in particular is made of 70% organic bamboo viscose and 25% organic cotton, so it is definitely unique to any other article of clothing I own. I like how the material feels different from other V-necks I own - this one by Fisher's Finery is significantly softer and stretchier than those by Target, H&M, and Forever 21.

My only criticism is that the fit is a bit off. I am a true size-medium at nearly every store I shop at, but this V-neck in particular was a little bit too loose-fitting for my preferences. I also have a large chest, so this shirt fit a bit awkwardly since the V-neck opening is high up and the bottom of the shirt flares out past my hips, making my shape look less feminine and defined. However, this V-neck tee has turned out to be perfect for my relaxing days or when I am out running errands.

I received this ecofabric V-neck tee for the purposes of unbiased testing and reviewing. To reiterate, it is very soft and comfortable, so I would absolutely recommend it if you are looking for less clingy tees that are primarily breathable and relaxing.

These are thicker than I expected, and nicer quality than the little stretch mittens I thought I was getting. These fit my 2 year old, 4 year old, and 6 year old, so we've gotten pretty good use out of the pack. They do come on a string, and at first it appears that the string is intended to be strung through the coat sleeves so the mittens aren't lost. One good tug, however, and the mittens come right off the string - they are simply glued on. This is not a big deal to me, as I wasn't expecting it anyway, but be aware of this if you are hoping for the string to be useful for you - it's not. Otherwise, these are great, inexpensive little mittens that you won't mind too much if the kids lose this winter. And if they don't, they're good enough quality that you can use them again next winter!

reviewText: Packaging had enough cushion so that the straw wasn't broken, authentic, with tags included, great product.

In leaving this feedback, my hope is that Amazon will ask if the hat fits. Well Amazon yes, yes it does-but that is the only positive part of my recent order. The order itself was two days late. Not a HUGE deal, other than this hat purchased as a river hat that was hopefully going to accompany me down a sunny section of the Colorado River yesterday. I adapted though, these things happen.. A lot it seems with Amazon these days, but they still do happen...

Now for the quality of the hat which is what most people are interested in when looking at reviews... The hat fits really well. Snug, but not overly tight. I wish that I could provide more quantitative information because everyone's head size/shape is a little different, but for me it fit nicely.

I have been in possession of this hat for exactly 20 minutes and upon delivery I immediately opened the box. Upon inspection, the hat had 2 tears in the top of it as you can see from the pictures. They are not HUGE tears, ~2" but how long do you really think this hat is going to last considering that it is ALREADY torn and has not even been worn (I should have rhymed this entire review for your reading pleasure...) The package itself did not seem to be damaged, and the hat had had a plastic form inserted inside the hat for shipping that was meant to keep its shape. And it did. Therefore, I'm guessing that the damaged hat was packaged and shipped as it was.. Not good-amazon quality control, not good...

I will be returning the hat today, and I have cancelled my Prime membership. There is just no value in Prime when I continually get packages late or receive products that I just need to return anyway. If this was an isolated incident, I would let it go. It's not, so I can't. I would say with regards to the hat, roll the dice. I read the reviews, I saw how many positive reviews there were, and I felt comfortable enough to order it myself. You may get lucky, or you may not. If not, Amazon is a good enough company to refund you and fix the issue. All you will be out is time, effort, and just a little bit of your soul... (ok, maybe that was dramatic, but it is still a huge pain sometimes returning crap that should have been inspected BEFORE it is shipped)!
summary: but for me it fit nicely. I have been in possession of this hat ...

reviewText: Well-made with a fit as expected (L/XL).

I bought this hat for my husband to keep the sun off of his fair skin for a vacation to lake powell. He wore it while boating with higher winds and while jumping off of 30 ft cliffs into the water and it held up great. One of our friends had a different straw hat and it was completely destroyed by the end of the trip while this one still looks like new. Plus he was able to avoid a sunburn for 5 days! As you can see my husband didn't like the original logo on the front of the patch so he asked me to replace it with this Valhalla patch we already owned. You can remove the original patch by clipping the threads and ripping the patch away from the hat however you will not be able to completely remove the glue adhesive without damaging the hat but that was not a problem as I just hot glued his new patch over the top of it.

reviewText:
This is my second O'Neill straw hat.  I have a slightly bigger head (7 1/2 - 7 5/8) and the hat fits nicely.  On my first hat, nothing has actually broken.  The stitching around the rim is so good.  The spring ball works, the straw has not cracked or broken down.  I actually got a new one because of the reasonable price and my old one was starting to get really misshapen.  It's a broad hat that I would leave it in the garage and it got pushed around.  Highly recommend hanging it up if you want to keep the shape.

So why the three stars?  All Amazons fault.  It came in a box that was about an inch narrower in height and width and depth.  So now my brand new round hat is not round.  It has four slight creases that match the box.  They aren't awful but for a brand new product that I was buying specifically for no creases or bends, it's a big letdown.  The top pushed back out.  To be clear,  it's noticeable to me and may be no big deal to you.  (See photos)
summary: Great hat, packaging not so much.

There are two approaches to designing and producing  a sun protective natural fiber straw type hat:  The way Tula does it using time honored quality materials and craftsmanship and the  way O'neill does it with the MBA/ California style of anything goes and we hope it works.  This hat fit good and I really liked it until I discovered its 2 big flaws.
  2.  The straw is really cheap and the fibers break up from one wearing on a  motor boat  whereas my Tula hat lasted for years of wearing on land and water
  1.  To compensate for cheap material and cheap workmanship, O'neill installed a liner under the entire brim to block the sun because the straw does not.  That part works but they put no liner under the crown, perhaps to save money on labor or because they were dumb to figure out how to do it or to make the hat cooler.  This hat is a medical device in that it is represented to protect the wearer from the dangers of sun exposure and the standards by which it is reviewed need be very high.  Wearing this hat by any wearer who does not have a dense coat of hair on the top of their head exposes the wearer's scalp to sun exposure and damage.
summary: Cheap Material,  Flawed Design,  Nice hat otherwise,  Does not protect top of head from sun exposure.

I can't recall ever being so satisfied with a clothing purchase as I have been with this.

It's not my style to leave glowing reviews after opening an item. No matter how something looks, it should be durable and practical, something that cannot be done after a several-weeks trial. I purchased this very wide-brimmed hat in 2015 and wore it all last season, and it has held up very well into this summer season (late July 2016). Although the inside of the brim is lined with a dark (in the case of my hat, "Sonoma Stars" red/white/blue) fabric, I feel that this adds the right amount of stiffness and durability to the item so that it does not easily flap around in the wind; it may also make it a tad warmer, as others have noted. In my view, though, the extra stability is worth it to protect the wearer from the sun. The straw weave and chin strap have held up well, and all stitching has remained intact. I purchased it initially only for use around the exterior of the house (I thought its flamboyance was not the style for this staid, elderly gent) - gardening and mowing the lawn - but this year I have dared to walk downtown wearing it and I have received lots of compliments on the hat. My days of only wearing a baseball cap with a visor in front for sun protection, are over.

Note that of the hundreds of reviews left for this O'Neill hat few, if any, are left by professional reviewers in the Amazon "Vine Program", a program that has trashed the integrity of Amazon's review system. People who are in the business of being sent as much free merchandise as they can get their grubby hands on to write creative reviews for products they may have only looked at but not used, cannot be "unbiased" as they purport them to be. I don't know whether they sell their free stuff through eBay stores, save them for giving as gifts, or dispose of them at garage sales, but their mere existence has gotten me to reduce my formerly large volume of online purchases and get back into brick and mortar stores to check out quality for myself, before I buy, as I feel like a chump for being one of the few people to pay the asking price for online goods. I do applaud Amazon that they do identify which reviews are written by these people who receive free items. Sorry for this editorial paragraph, but I had to get this comment off my chest. Amazon should note that this is a Verified Purchase by me.
summary: Shady, cool, practical hat for the summer sun and heat

The width of the brim does limit movement at times, but it's sun blocking abilities still gives it 5 stars.

reviewText: Soft and true to size

I spent three long days mapping in the desert in Central Oregon, across steep, rugged terrain and in direct sunlight.  I didn't apply sunscreen to my face because I knew I'd be sweating and didn't want it in my eyes.  I wore this the whole time, and didn't get burned on my face or neck; quite an accomplishment in 90 degree weather with no shade to speak of.  I've got a bigger than normal noggin and this hat fits comfortably snug.  There's a drawstring to keep it on in windy conditions and it didn't fly off my head once when it was drawn.  It's pretty sturdy, too.  It was a little bent in the shipping box when I received it but it just adds a little character to it -- it's got a little bit of a swoosh on the front brim.  No big deal in my book.  All in all I like it, just don't expect to take selfies while wearing it -- the black fabric on the underside of the brim effectively blocks all sunlight, shrouding your face in shadow.
summary: Fits big heads, sturdy and definitely blocks the sun from your face and neck

We are heading to Cancun again in two weeks and I am going to be prepared! reviewText: This is my second time purchasing this hat. My husband needed to block the sun from his face and back of his neck when coaching football. A regular baseball cap just wasn't cutting it. This gives him protection in front and back of his head so he doesn't get burned out on the field.  He uses it out and around the pool also. Doesn't replace sunscreen but definitely an added protection. Great buy!

Edit: Looks like they changed the design, the old emblem on the front was large and round, the new picture is smaler. This review may no longer be valid if they changed more than just the emblem. My hat is closest to the "Natural" version they sell in 2018 based on the pictures

This sea straw holds up better than the thin stuff they use on the new style of straw hats, much stronger stuff. A month of rough use and no damage at all so far.

The underside has a glued black cotton (I think) layer to help keep tiny sun spots from shining through the straw, making this hat less distracting than my last straw hat. The inside has a thin elastic band to make it fit more comfortably, no more straw poking my forehead.

The chin cord looks frayed, like it was "brushed" to look old like they do with "fashionable" jeans these days. It's softer than most cords because of this (less itchy on chin), but I'm concerned it might have reduced the cord's lifespan.

The brim is so wide that it reduces head range of motion if you're wearing something bulky on/around your back/shoulders (backpack, lifevest, seat/chair, costume) but is very light and comfortable otherwise. Good for yard work and beach, not good for kayak fishing.

The emblem on the front is ugly and prevents air from moving through the front of the hat, but you can cut the stitching on the back, and the glue they used is so soft you can gently pull it off from there without hurting the straw, no heatgun required.

One Year Edit: I still use this hat one year later, I've found it expands too much when it gets soaked so don't use it in the rain it will expand enough that it no longer rests on your head but on your ears, and is heavy when soaked with water. Leaving it to dry it shrank back to the original  size though.

The steel eyelets for the chinstrap are not stainless or coated, they rusted in the presence of salt water (ocean use). If you take this hat to the beach I suggest you rinse the eyelets to keep them from rusting too much. The chinstrap stopper has a steel spring that has rusted too, but it still works so far.

Otherwise, this hat has held up well enough for a straw hat, imo. The only damage is on the very top, and I blame myself for smacking it on things, because I'm used to being short enough to go under, and the hat increases my height several inches.
Very nice quality.

reviewText: great hat for the summer and they are getting harder to find so get em while they are avail!!!

This is a decent hat and I'm torn about the review. Some aspects are great, others are very lacking. Let's start with my head size, I wear a 7 3/8 - 7 1/2 fitted caps (bigger noggin, but not enormous). In regards to the hat, the black fabric under the rim really helps reduce glare (I used the hat at beaches and many pool decks and can attest to this) but, it only comes in one size and that one size is a bit too small for my head. I realize my large dome is my problem and this hats fits most people well or even a bit too big. But, the rim of the hat sits funny, got oddly molded in the box it was shipped it (which was too small for the hat) and it's never really recovered to normal. The bill has always had this weird ridge in it right where it meets the top part of the hat, and it sits unevenly. I've been battling with the bill of this hat since day one to try and get it to sit normal in a nice disc shape. But, the strap is nice, the padding on the inside of the hat that goes around your dome to prevent scratchy straw on your skin is also a nice touch. If you have a big dome or like your straw hats to sit nicely and not warp and get bent out of shape, you may want to try buying a handmade hat from someone at a local farmers market....at least that's what I had to do.

UPDATE: After about 2 years this hat started to break down considerably, should be noted that it did get worn about 1-4x a month and bumped around occasionally in the house with the hats, but nothing abnormal. It's a straw hat so some of the breakdown was expected and none of the holes prevented it from being used properly (unless you have a bald head in which case it could cause a weird sunburn...luckily my hair is long). But, the woven hat material became very fragile after a year or so and started easily breaking off from touching almost anything after about 2 years.
Good luck!

reviewText: I work as a crossing guard during very hot, peak sun hours of the day. I have the misfortune of being pale skinned and I also walk to and from work, so I needed more than just the shade around the eyes for an hour. This hat works perfectly. The inside is lined with black fabric, so the glare from the reflective material used in the crosswalk is hindered quite a bit. The fabric also keeps the sun from coming through, unlike other straw and fabric hats. In addition, this hat is very stiff, keeping my field of vision open so that I can see all around me. The cord does a fine job in high wind conditions, and the bead in the cord is spring loaded, so it does not slide down after wearing for a while, but stays put. The upper crown of the hat is not lined, but their is a band just the inside of the crown for sweat absorption. Not having fabric in the top of the hat is helpful for keeping the head cool.  I was initially hesitant to purchase this hat, as my head is large for a woman, and I was afraid the brim would only cover a small portion of my face like other hats have. This is not the case. The brim is 5.5 inches wide, and covers my face, neck, and some of my shoulder when directly under the sun. The depth of the crown is about 6 inches deep, 6 1/2 inches wide at the base, and 8 inches long (since the crown is not rounded, but oblong). I am not sure of my hat size, but the circumference of my head is about 22 inches, and the fit is not quite snug. I do, however, wear my waist length hair in a bun on the top of my head when I work, and the bottom of the crown comes to rest just above my brow. This makes the hat snug for me. Overall, the hat seems pretty durable: the straw is very stiff, and high wind, heat, and moisture have not caused it to bend at all. I believe the fabric lining also keeps it sturdy. I should caution, this is not a hat for fashion, but a reliable utility hat. If it breaks down, I would purchase the same one again, but I don't see that happening in the near future.  A very good product overall.
summary: Just The Thing I Was Looking For

Only those in the market for a serious sun-hat need apply. I bought this for my hubby. He spends more than his share of time outdoors. I wanted a hat that didn't scream, "My wife is making me wear this stupid thing". The Oneill Sonoma more than fits the bill. It's a manly-man's hat, but I wouldn't mind wearing it. The brim is HUGE. Not only does the Sonoma protect his face and neck, most of his shoulders are also shaded from the sun. Definitely exceeded my expectations. The underside of the brim is lined with a dark felt or something similar. This keeps the sun from shining through the spaces in the straw. The draw cord is substantial. They're not kidding when they say this is a lifeguard style hat. All these great features would be worthless if he refused to wear it. When it arrived, I hung it on the backdoor and listened for his reaction. I heard him say, "Holy smokes!" That's a good thing, by the way. He's worn it ever since. Now I wish I could get him to remember to take the darn thing off when he comes inside.

I love this wallet. It's so original and beautifully made! I've received so many compliments on it. It's compact, so it fits really well in small purses and bags. The ID card slot is really great-- the cards never slip out (which was a concern I read in one review). The only downside is that since it's small, it doesn't hold a lot of change. I generally stash a LOT of change in my wallet, so this may not be a huge concern for others. It can hold a handful of coins, but I wouldn't stuff it any more than that. It also has two pockets for cash and cards. In terms of cash, it can hold as much as I think anyone would want to carry on them, and I have about 8 or 9 cards, which seems to be about the limit for how many can fit.

The image on the wallet is beautiful. However the fit and finish of the wallet is rough and sloppy.  Where the fabric wraps around to the inside it's rather rough. It would be better if they tucked  the  raw edge  of the fabric in or covered it

It will probably last through this winter, but not into next winter. I was hoping for better, but be warned this is not going to last long.  Also note that the stitching is very large and it is a highly bulky scarf.  I wanted bulky, but with a better quality.  TitFus be aware that the quality needs improvement.

I refuse to call them anything but a little girls panty.
I do however wish you would have more options on Amazon, so I could by more :-)

The quality is great and are so soft.  We'll never go back to store bought.  I also love that they're white, because girls clothing (tights/shorts) seem to all be see through and anything with a color/pattern can be seen through.  These underwear are perfectly concealed.

Update:  so after a few washes, some of the underwear came apart... literally ripping at the seams.  So disappointed!

Update 2:  The seller contacted me and sent me a new pack of underwear to replace the ones that came apart (free of charge).  So far so good.  I still love the softness and the fact that they're not visible under thin pants.  The quality overall seems great!  You do want to consider going a size up as they are a little smaller than department store ones or children's stores.  These are the only type of underwear my daughter will wear.

If you're looking for a cheap costume for a single night, it's great. It is very stretchy and fits a range of sizes very well.
But if you're looking for something that looks a bit more professional and is easier to manage, I would suggest looking elsewhere. To start off with, the fin looks cheaply made. The seams aren't very securely stitched, and are even sometimes sewn backwards (!) so around the seam you have the  remaining fabric frayed out all around the edges. Secondly, putting it on is very difficult. Both sides of the flipper are cut exactly the same, so there is no place for your ankles to bend, and that aside, at the start of the opening for the flipper it seems to be sewn for only one foot, or just the toes for both. Good luck trying to get your feet comfortably into it. Also, though it would fit perfectly someone with a wider frame,  If you have long legs I would turn around now while you still can. Though I don't have a very large butt, I have long grasshopper-like legs. No matter how I tried to stretch it, it only wanted to come up to the middle of where I wanted it to cover. (This is with the largest size) There was still plenty of room for my thighs, but it did not want to stretch to fit over my butt.
My suggestion: if you want a cheap mermaid fin and you have short legs and a good size fanny, as well as a willing family member to carry you to wherever you need to be, go ahead and get it. But if you want something that looks professional, that fits comfortably, and that you can use for more than one use, buckle down and fork over the money for a more expensive--but better made--one elsewhere.

reviewText: The only reason I am putting ONE star on this item is because Amazon won't except it without a rating. The picture  tells the wrong story. It is Shear, Ugly, sizes like it is to fit a toddler, and isn't worth the cost or hassle to send  back. So it will now go into my Goodwill pile. Be Careful buying clothes from Amazon. make sure you read the hidden small print.

reviewText:
The quality of this hat and the yarn used is great, it's well-knit with no noticeable flaws.  It fits comfortably on my head (I have a VERY large head for a woman, can't wear normal-sized women's hats), but isn't too large and would also fit an average person.  My husband can also wear it, though he has a real beard too, so it's a bit tight on the chin.

However, the mustache section is too loose and flops around awkwardly (possibly so it's loose enough to go over your chin?).  If this section were a little tighter knit, it would be an amazingly funny hat.  As is, it still makes a great gag gift, and is definitely useable, but you may want to get some matching brown yarn and tie the mustache section a little tighter if you want a perfect custom fit.

(I received a discount on this product in exchange for testing, inspecting and reviewing it.  I received no other compensation for my review and always give my honest and unbiased opinion of each product. I am disclosing this in accordance with the Federal Trade Commissions 16 CFR, Part 255: Guides Concerning the Use of Endorsements and Testimonials in Advertising.)

reviewText: Of all of the religious necklaces on the market, this is the best one I have found for my taste. A lot of the "sculpted" pieces lack detail, are too small to be recognizable or so big as to be gaudy and most are not adjustable length-wise. This piece is the perfect statement for someone who has strong beliefs but doesn't want  to make it appear that you are shouting it from the rooftops. The wooden centerpiece is designed to reflect the wood of the cross and is engraved on one side with the word "FORGIVEN" and the other with the famous "JOHN 3:16"  reference. The cross is a depiction of two nails arranged to form the cross and is a very powerful visual. The rawhide cord is adjustable, making it easy to pair it with any other necklace or chain. I have gotten more reaction and compliments on this piece because of its understated simplicity. It's the perfect way to let people know of your faith without appearing to beat them over the head with it. It's guaranteed to be a "conversation piece" and, for the money, an excellent  product.
summary: A TASTEFUL AND  SIMPLE DECLARATION OF FAITH.

I can fix the loose stitching myself but I don't think that I can take that stupid elastic band out without ruining the dress. All in all, unhappy.

reviewText: Camillas corsets are awesome. These are not cheaply made. They are the real deal.

After having 2 large babies, I was trying to find something to help control the pooch.  I looked for the longest that was available.  However, this didn't tame it.  It only made it look funny and gave me unwanted back boobs.  Oh well, at least it wasn't very expensive.

This corset feels like a really good quality for waist training, and much less expensive than a lot of the big brands. It doesn't feel cheap at all and looks really good too. Sizing is on point as well. I love it, but would suggest anyone do research on waist training before attempting cuz it can be dangerous. Otherwise if it's just for fashion and you're not actually planning on sizing Down with it, go up a size, cuz the back can look a little messy and won't close all the way since it's designed to shrink you down to the point where the backs eventually meet.
Outstandingly good. Beyond my expectations

This product fits as expected and is made out of sturdy material. After seasoning it for a few days, I was able to tighten it so that the modesty panel was completely covering my back. The cording on the back is made from a heavy duty material, so it can withstand a lot of pulling, however the side satin ribbons might have to be replaced due to lack of strength, however I have yet to do this, because it seems to be holding up fine. The under the breast design was also great, I don't have a very large chest so it helped to make everything a bit more perky.

Only thing that would have been nice to have was maybe a direction sheet about different lacing techniques, its kind of annoying to have a large bulge of cord at the small of your back. It can be difficult to hide.
summary: ... product fits as expected and is made out of sturdy material. After seasoning it for a few days

reviewText: I love this corset!

I am new into waist cinchers, but spent quite a bit of time looking before making my purchase. I was very please with the quality of the product. There was nothing else in the package aside from the garment. I guess I was expecting to see some type of tag attached, and maybe even a card with some helpful hints?  I ordered the XL  Long cut thinking that that as a tall woman, I am 5'9" weighing about 170 lbs with a 33 " waist, that the long cut would be a better fit.
The sizing in diameter is spot on, but I think I am going to need to change this corset for the regular length one. It is a tad too high under the bust line, and the part that points up in the middle is too high and really digs into me.
My only other disappointment,, and this isn't really the garments fault, is the spillage I am having on the top of my back. I am going to need to play around with some bra's and see if one with a wider band can help control that.
If it wasn't for the fact the the corset is too long, I found it comfortable, liked the back support I got from it, and had no issues breathing.  Hopefully once I get the correct length, the "girls" won't pour out as bad...I like them supported, but at 50 years old, I don't need them at my chin! lol (it only looks bad with my arms down)
Shipping was fast, and hopefully the return will be painless. I am looking forward to receiving the next one!
I would purchase this item from the seller again.
summary: that the long cut would be a better fit. The sizing in diameter is spot on

reviewText: My first corset purchase. I wanted to try waist training but wasn't sure if the process was for me. Therefore I want a good quality product without paying a fortune for it. This corset met my goals. I was afraid the steel bones would make wearing a corset uncomfortable but that isn't the case. The soft layers of fabric buffers the rigidity of the steel bones without diminishing the effectiveness of the corset. Because the corset is so well made  and comfortable, I am actually looking forward to using it. Recommend.
summary: Shrinks your Waist not your Pocketbook

reviewText:
I LOVE this corset! I have only had it for a few weeks and haven't worn it for a long period of time, but I expect it should work well for tight lacing and waist reduction.

I am 5'5", about 128lbs. My underbust measures 29", waist 27" (measured snug, not too tight), hips 36". Originally I ordered the size medium, which did fit nicely, but I was able to lace it closed completely on the first try. This might be fine for some people, but this is not going to reduce your waist size over time (which I would like). I exchanged for the small, and the small is perfect for me. When lace tight I have about a 2" gap all the way down the center back. As I continue to wear it I am hoping to have my waist reduce a bit, and the corset should eventually close at the waist at center back.

The quality for the price is petty incredible. I have never seen anything this sturdy at this price!!! The busk is steel and reinforced with steel stays on each side. The center back has 2 steel stays on each side of the grommets as well. This seems like it will hold up to a lot of wear without bending over time (I have had this problem with other cheep corsets!).The rest of the corset has steel spiral boning throughout, which will help it hold its shape but flex to your curves. It feels like the small pieces of boning that reinforce the grommets at the hips are plastic, but that is fine in my opinion - its such a small piece it shouldn't warp over time. The overall feel is amazingly sturdy. I have such great posture when I have it on! I love the length of the corset - it certainly eliminates any muffin top or bulging you might have on your belly/hips.

A cute surprise is the lining - it is white and grey leopard print! (On the medium it has a little blue in it too). I think it's a nice detail to have. It's fun, and you can't see it at all once the corset is on and laced. The lacing up the center back is nice and long and sturdy. The lacing on the hips is just regular poly satin ribbon. I might want to replace that at some point to a stronger lace but for now its fine.

Overall, amazing buy for a beginner corset! It's a great way to get a feel if you like wearing corsets without investing a ton of money. I'm so glad I made this purchase :)

reviewText:
Just got my corset in the mail today! I have amazon prime so it came very quickly. Ok, first things first, all of you ladies that left bad reviews need to understand more about corsets! To effectively train your waist your corset needs to be 2-6" smaller than your actual waistline! Therefore, the corset will be smaller and tighter than your waist and is NOT supposed to completely close in the back when you first get it. You have to "train" your waist to get it that size, which is the whole point! Once you are able to wear your corset completely laced shut it's time to get the next size down and start the process again, unless you are happy with that size and don't wish to go any smaller. Another thing I must address to all the ladies having trouble with their corset breaking, when you first buy a corset you MUST "season" it! Basically, gently break it in. You can't just pop it out of the box and force it as tight as it will go or you will warp the steel boning and strain the fabric! As you season your corset it will mold to your body and will be more comfortable to wear and will last you much longer. If you are unfamiliar with how to season a corset look it up on Google! All that being said, I think this corset is a good starter corset to try waist training to see if you like it. The boning in it is steel, I tested it with a really strong ceramic magnet...a refrigerator magnet might not be strong enough to get through all the layers of fabric. The boning is pretty flexible but that is to be expected at this price range. To get a corset with really thick bones you'd probably have to spend upwards of $200 or more. I bought this one because I recently had a baby and didn't want to invest in a really good corset until my weight stabilizes more. The best corsets you can buy are the custom made ones, but if you've never done waist training before I'd recommend buying one like this first to see if you like it because custom ones are very expensive. Overall I think this corset is fantastic for only being around $45! My only complaint is I wish they would use the same kind of ties on the sides that they use in the back of the corset...the side ties are done with cheap ribbon, but that's no big deal because I can easily replace those.
So ladies, BEFORE buying any corset DO YOUR RESEARCH!
5/29/2015 UPDATE REVIEW!
Ok so now that I've been breaking this corset in and was able to examine it more closely, I wanted to give you guys an update now that I'm more familiar with it. I compared it to my mid-range one which was around $100 and here are my findings!
This corset does have an attached modesty panel measuring aprox 5" long, the item description says it has a 100% cotton lining but the tag says it is 90% polyester,  5% cotton, and 5% elastin. (A waist training corset should NOT have elastin in it as this gives some stretch to the fabric.) This corset has a 1/2" busk that is 12" in length with a 3/8" flat bone sewn next to it for added strength. Personally I  prefer the 1" busks as they provide more support, but they did it this way because it's cheaper. They claim this corset has 26 spiral steel bones but this is incorrect. It actually has 16 spiral steel bones and 4 PLASTIC short bones that are placed along side the ties. It also includes a total of 6 flat steel bones, giving this corset a grand total of 22 actual STEEL BONES. The four short plastic bones are 5" long and I know they are plastic because I tested every single bone with a strong ceramic magnet. The description said there is a waist tape but I have yet to find it, I know some are sewn between fabrics to make them less visible but you can still see them if you look at the inside at an angle. I'm not saying there definitely isn't one, I'm  just saying I can't find it at all.
After wearing this corset for a couple days to break it in I did notice that some of the material is pulling away from the grommets, nothing major though. It is getting more comfortable to wear as I break it in.  Since this material has a very slight stretch to it I may end up using it as my sleeping corset since your body expands when you sleep this could be ideal for that.
My more expensive corset has 3/8" spiral steel bones, 1/2" flat steel bones, and 1" steel busk. This corset has 3/8" spiral steel bones, 3/8" flat steel bones and 1/2" steel busk. Just to give you an idea of what spending an extra $50 gets you, and so you are now aware that just because something is listed as having more bones doesn't necessarily mean it's better. The more expensive one had thicker tougher bones which will give you better shaping even though it has less bones than this cheaper one. I'd rather pay $100 for 24 strong steel bones then $45 for 26 thin steel and plastic bones. Anyway, amazon carries a great line of corsets from "What Katie Did", but they will cost you over $200, another great place to get a quality corset is Isabella's corset, they are cheaper than what katie did but still make a nice strong corset for under $200. And no, I'm not affiliated with either of them, just trying to be helpful because I know how hard it is to find a reputable corset shop!
I hope I covered everything and helped you with your decision! I will post a picture soon as soon as I finish seasoning it! Happy corset hunting! ;)
Ps: for reference I'm 5'7 about 156 lbs. And my waist measure came to 31 1/2" , I  ordered the size large and am able to lace it close enough for the modesty panel to reach the other side. I could have ordered the next size up but since I'm losing weight I didn't want to have to order a new one in a month or two.

reviewText: These mitten/gloves worked very well for my purposes.  The range of colors and sizes was of great importance in my list of requirements.  I bought four pair and wanted them to be distinctive enough so each of the recipients would recognize theirs.  In general I need these only for occasional visits from my family.  I share them among those who somehow forgot their gloves or mittens.  They aren't the most durable in the world, but they aren't the most expensive either.  They work perfectly for my occasional family visitors.  One great thing is that I was able to get a range of sizes so I always have the right fit on hand.  The youngest marveled at fact that he now had benefit from both gloves and mittens and he was happy to demonstrate and make good use of both options.  Ultimately, for me it was a good balance of function and price.  I would buy them again and probably will.

I'm giving this corset three stars only because I consider that to be an average rating. When I say average I am talking about corsets in this price range. I bought this corset as a surprise for my wife. Immediately she liked the design. It fit her very nicely and she was comfortable in it, Fortunately she has curves in all the right places for a corset. I was able to get the lacing just right to give her a snug fit and have it look great.

 My wife owns many different types of corsets, one of which is handmade and cost in the hundreds. She's been wearing corsets off and on for close to 10 years. That being said I'm fairly confident in saying that this corset is more of a costume piece then a shapewear peace. If your intention is to do any kind of body shaping this is not the piece for you. If you want something sexy and fun to wear as a corset, either on top of clothes or not, this corset is can be lot of fun. The materials used in making this corset are very basic. The outer shell is a stretchy imprinted vinyl that is lined on the inside. It provides some shape and support but it is definitely not the type of boning you would see in a corset designed for body shaping; boning in those types of corsets are made out of metal and are far more frigid. You would probably find similar corsets in the mall, maybe at a Spencers. No one will ever confuse this corset with a high priced one when they see you in it. But they will say it is cute, sexy and fun.

reviewText: They came 3 weeks early and are great!! they fit good and don't bend like other cheap hoops!

Measure your nose! These aren't for people with big or small noses! These are for people whose nose measures about 8mm (or 5/16") from piercing to edge of nostril. That's what that measurement is there for... Use it.

On to my review... These are great! The measurements are accurate (I used a cm tape measure) and they only took 10 days to get to me! That's really fast for China to the US. Projected arrival was supposed to be another 2-4 weeks so I'm really impressed with the shipping.

Another thing I'm impressed with is the color of the gold mix/aurora hoops. Usually these end up being just an ombre of two colors or some kind of gold fade, but these are a good mix of colors! And with a set, I'm surprised both actually match!

Love my little TARDIS necklace. It's pretty heavy, and I wouldn't recommend giving it to children under the age of 15, but it'd a nice stylized shape of the classic TARDIS box, and the writing is pretty clear. Mine came with a tiny blue 'jewel' on top that's smaller than the image but fits the whole color scheme very well.

My package also came with a little cell phone strap , in case I wanted to change it out from a necklace to a cell phone charm. It's also got some weight to it. I really like it. Shipping took about three weeks. For the price (about $2) it's totally worth it.
